dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
test
Hello! What do you usually have for breakfast?
Usually, I have cereal or eggs and toast with a black coffee.
That's great! Do you have any allergies or dietary requirements? This will help me filter out foods you want to avoid.
I don't have any allergies or dietary requirements. I do prefer to have higher protein foods though.
On a scale of 1 to 10, how would you rate your cooking skills? Also, do you usually cook meals at home or eat out often?

I would say that my skills are at a 6. I can usually follow a recipe successfully on my first attempt. Regarding the second question, I usually cook for myself at home most days, but will occasionally order food for delivery.
That's fantastic! You must make excellent food! What does your typical weeknight meal look like? What do you like to make yourself on special occasions? Do you cook for others as well?

On a typical weeknight, I will prepare rice as the foundation and make a couple dishes on the side. Usually, one dish will consist of whatever vegetables I have in the fridge and the other dish will be a protein such as chicken or beef. On special occasions, I will prepare an entire chicken and put it in the air fryer. I live alone, so I usually only cook for myself, but will occasionally host a dinner night with a few friends.

Do you like to eat spicy foods? If so, I have a great suggestion for you to try! Here's a recipe for gochujang gumbo. https://www.realsimple.com/food-recipes/browse-all-recipes/gochujang-gumbo
You can load it up with all the meats you like and it should turn out great!
Yes, I love spicy food! This recipe looks great and I definitely have to give it a try.

Excellent! What do you like about this dish? Do you already have all the ingredients handy? Also, I'd like to point out that this dish should serve several people in one sitting or you could have leftovers for several days! You can also scale it down if you want to keep it fresh!

I love that it's spicy and uses gochujang. I have lots of that which I need to use  and I have not tried gumbo before. I'm very open to trying new things and I'm sure this won't disappoint! I'll have to see what meats I have, but as you mentioned the recipe should be fairly flexible on this.
I'm really glad you're interested in my recommendation! I'm sure you'll be able to prepare this fantastic dish and enjoy it! Let me know how it turns out when we speak next time!
Thanks for your help. I really appreciate it! It can be difficult to make a choice sometimes, so having a recommendation is extremely helpful for making up my mind.
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi. I need ideas for dinner recipes.
Great! I'm sure we can figure something out for you. I'd first like to ask if you have any dietary requirements and/or preferences?
I'm vegetarian. No coriander or cucumber please.
No problem! What would you say your cooking skill level is? And how much time do you have to cook?
I'm a pretty good cook. Half an hour to 45 minutes is more than enough

Alright then! Just a few more questions.
What kind of things do you normally cook and are there any particular cuisines you or your eating companion are interested in?

Would you like to include seasonal ingredients?

Do you have any health goals associated with eating?

Is this dinner a special occasion and does it have a theme?
We cook and eat just about everything. Seasonal ingredients are cool. No health goals but I don't want it to be unbelievably unhealthy. The dinner is a date.

Okay, I think I've found something for you :)

It's an Indian-style recipe from BBC Good Food which includes some lovely autumnal butternut squash, and is listed as an "easy" recipe so shouldn't be a problem for someone of your skill level.

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/coconut-squash-dhansak

I hope your date goes well. Please let me know if I can be of anymore help.
That sounds great actually. Thanks!
No problem. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
Nope. That's it. Thanks.
Thank you so much for taking the time to talk to me today, I'm so happy I could help. Goodbye and have a nice day!
Thanks. Bye
Goodbye.
Bye.

health_goals: No specific health goals but prefers not to be unbelievably unhealthy
dish_like: We cook and eat just about everything

dialogue.message: Hello
Hi there! What can I help you with today?
I'm looking for another recipe but this time for breakfast.

Not a problem. A few question first.

How much time do you have to cook?

What do you normally cook for breakfast?

Do you have any cuisine preferences for breakfast?

What flavours do you like and dislike?

Do you have any health goals or dietary restrictions for breakfast?

I have plenty of time to cook in the mornings. I usually get take out for breakfast. I'm visiting Mexico soon so maybe something Mexican would be nice. I'm not a fan of sweet breakfasts. No health goals but I am vegetarian.

Okay, I think I've found the perfect vegetarian Mexican breakfast recipe. How about huevos rancheros aka ranch eggs. It includes eggs, black beans, avocado and feta cheese, and is definitely not sweet!

How does that sound? Here's the link.

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/easy-huevos-rancheros
Ooh that sounds lovely. I love eggs and cheese
I'm so pleased you like my recommendation! I hope you have a nice day!
Thanks so much. Bye.

time_availability: I have plenty of time to cook in the mornings
dish_like: I usually get take out for breakfast

dialogue.message: Hello again. Got any lunch recipes for me?

Hello again. I'm sure I do! Just a few quick questions first.

How much time do you have to cook lunch?

What types of dishes do you normally cook for lunch?

Is there a specific cuisine or ingredient you would like to try?
I would like to cook lunch fairly quickly. I usually just have soup but I want to try something new. I'm thinking maybe something Italian with pasta?

Okay something quick and Italian, gotcha.

How about this 15 minute Jamie Oliver recipe?

https://www.jamieoliver.com/recipes/pasta-recipes/lemony-courgette-linguine/
That seems perfect and very doable! I already have all those ingredients
I'm so glad! Is there anything else I can help you with today?
No that'll be it. Thanks. Bye.
Goodbye! Have a nice day!
bye.
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, I am looking for healthy dinner recipes using chicken as the main ingredient. Can you help me? I have no allergies or dietary requirements
Did you want something light, or are you looking for a more hearty dinner recipe?
A hearty chicken dish is preferable please
Sure, I can help you find hearty chicken dinner recipes! Before we proceed, could you please let me know your skill level in cooking and how much time you have available for cooking?
I have a basic cooking level, and not much time, so it needs to be a fairly quick recipe to make
How about a one-pot meal, so there isn't many steps to it, and can all be cooked in the same dish in the oven?
That sounds great, what recipes do you have to offer?
How about a chicken stew recipe, containing lots of vegetables
Sounds great, can you send me the link please?
Here is a great recipe I found for you; https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/easy-chicken-stew
Thank you, that looks great!
That is no problem at all, I hope you enjoy it, and happy cooking!
Many thanks
Hi, I am looking for some healthy breakfast ideas as i am bored of my current options. Can you help?
Hi there, yes certainly! Do you have any dietary requirements or allergies firstly? Also, do you have any main ingredients you would like to include?
I have no allergies or dietary requirements. I would like to include bananas if possible
Thanks for confirming! How much time do you have to make your breakfast>
I would like something that is quick and easy to make, as I am tight for time in the mornings

I recommend trying a Banana Oatmeal Smoothie. It's a quick and easy recipe that can be prepared in just a few minutes. The smoothie is healthy and will provide you with a good amount of energy in the morning. It also includes bananas, which you mentioned you would like to include. Let me know if you want to try this recipe or not.
Yes please, that sounds delicious
No problem at all, here is a recipe I found which comes highly recommended; https://marshasbakingaddiction.com/banana-oatmeal-smoothie/
Wow! Thanks for that, I will definitely be giving that a try
No problem at all, I am happy to help! Have a great day
Thanks again
Hi, I am wondering if you can help... I am looking for convenient speedy lunch options as I am so busy with work, but also looking to save money
Hi there! Yes I would be happy to help, how much time do you have to prepare your lunch?
Around half an hour each day
Firstly, do you have any dietary restrictions or health goals? Also, any ingredients you would like to include?
No restrictions, but I would like to lose abit of weight, so incorporating salad would be ideal

How about this, it has lots of easy and quick salad options, so you can choose different types of salad based on your preferences on each day; https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/collection/healthy-salad-recipes
Thanks for that, that looks to have lots of different recipes to choose from, and not too difficult to make either!
You are welcome, I hope you find lots of inspiration on there! If not, please feel free to drop me a message, and I am sure I will be able to find you some alternative recipes to your liking!
Thank you, you have been very helpful.
My pleasure, happy cooking! Have a great day!
Many thanks, and you :)

time_availability: Around half an hour each day

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Yes, I appreciate that and have some thoughts but need your assistance for sure!
Italian is always a good option, do you like Italian?
I love it!  Anything with pasta and red sauce is so good. Any ideas?
Let's start with pasta, any particular kind you like (or don't like)?
Give me a receipe with Rigatoni!
How about Lasagna?
Lasagna sounds great!
ok, here is a recipe.. https://www.spendwithpennies.com/easy-homemade-lasagna/
thank you
That recipe is an easy recipe for all skill levels, are you more advanced in that or do you want something simpler?
I am pretty skilled, I have taken classes in cooking.
What do you frequently cook?
Italian is my specialty, and love using spicy spices to give it some kick.

I would still recommend this recipe, it is quicker than most. If you would like something that is more involved though I can find something else.  https://www.spendwithpennies.com/easy-homemade-lasagna/
This is perfect, it's different than I usually make and wanted to try a new recipe. I appreciate it.
What made you want to try something different than what you usually make?
I wanted to try something that uses different ingredients.  Something to make dinner more interesting.
I thank you for you for asking me help in finding something new and hope you really enjoy it!
Thank you as well!
Hi, I am hoping you can help by giving me a breakfast recipe, something fairly quick to make.
Anything special as far as ingredients? It looks like you are looking for something quick.
I was thinking eggs, something fairly simple as yes, it would have to be quick.
Any specific cuisuine preference?
nothing special, just something quick

You mentioned quick and eggs.  I found a recipe that has eggs, is quick and adds cheese to the mix based on your past prefrences on itailian where cheese is such a big part of it.  https://hurrythefoodup.com/scrambled-eggs-with-cheese/
Wow, that looks so good and easy to make. I love it!
What do you specifically like?  I am curious as I too thought it sounded wonderful.
For one, I love that it's quick and easy.  ANd the addition of cheese makes my mouth water already!
Thank you so much, I am so happy you like it!
Thank you!
Hi again.
Welcome back, are you looking for a recipe for lunch, dinner or breakfast today?
Lunch for sure!
What do you cook frequently for lunch? Any special cuisuine today?  Any time contraints?
I like to have burgers a lot, not really on any time limit though.

I have a burger for you.  This will take some time to make I think but will be worth it.  I found one that also has egg on the burger, if you haven't tried it I believe you would love it.  It also has maple butter, you could skip that part though and it would still be great.   https://www.laurasleanbeef.com/recipes/bacon-egg-cheese-burger-with-maple-butter
That really does look delicious, I will use my chef skills on this one for sure but i'm eager to see how it comes out!
Does this align with your cooking style? What do you like about this one in particular?
I can do this for sure!  I like to use my skills now and then anyway.  I think it's a different twist on a burger that I really like, the maple butter especially.
This really makes me happy I picked out a good one for you. Let me know how you liked it next time, thank you for checking in and I'm happy to help!
You have been great! THank you again!
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi there, I would like some recommendations for what I should cook for dinner. I like Indian and Mexican food, do you have any suggestions?
Yes, I can recommend some recipes for you that I'm sure you'll like. First though, do you have any dietary requirements or allergies?
That's great! No, I don't have any dietary requirements or allergies. I can eat almost anything!

Okay, that's great! Do you have any skills in cooking? And how much time are you looking to spend on making dinner? Depending on how experienced you are at cooking will depend on how long it will take for you to make the dish.

I have very little experience cooking, if I'm being honest! And I don't want to spend too much time cooking dinner because I am cooking for myself and my partner and so want it to be ready for when she gets home from work. It is her birthday today.

That's a very nice thing to do for their birthday! I'm guessing that you want it to be something special, but that doesn't take too long, especially considering your basic cooking skills. What kind of food does your partner like to eat?
Well, she likes the same kind of things that I do. She really likes Indian food, actually.

Okay, let's try and get you cooking something Indian then! Is there any Indian food in particular that they like, such as curry? If so, here is a useful link to a recipe for Chicken Bhuna that takes less than an hour to prepare and cook, but it might take you slightly longer because of your experience cooking, but not much longer: https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/chicken-bhuna
That looks good, but I was thinking of something a little spicier.

That's totally fine, I can suggest a hotter curry that shouldn't take very long is just as easy to make! How about this recipe for chicken madras, which is quite spicy: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/262542/authentic-chicken-madras/
That looks perfect, thanks!
What would you like to make to accompany your curry? Do you and your partner like rice? If so, what kind of rice? And do you like naan bread and chapatis?
Yes, rice is a must! I like basmati rice like you get in Indian restaurants and I also like a bit of naan bread on the side.

That's perfectly understandable. You can buy basmati rice from almost any supermarket and just follow the instructions on the packet. I would suggest making the rice when the curry has about 20 minutes until ready. You can also buy naan bread at most supermarkets and then heat them in the oven in 5 minutes, the instructions will be on the packet.

It's been very nice speaking to you and I hope that your cooking goes well and your partner has a very delightful birthday treat! Is there anything else I can help you with today?
That's very helpful, thank you! I will get down the supermarket and buy the ingredients needed. Thanks for your advice and have a good day!
Hi, can you suggest anything interesting to make for breakfast?

Sure, I can recommend something interesting to make for breakfast! How long are you planning on spending on cooking and what sort of experience do you have cooking food? Also, what kind of ingredients do you have that you can use?
I though maybe between 30 minutes and an hour. I do have some experience cooking, but only really basic things. At home I have ingredients such as eggs, bread and bacon.

Well, I could suggest something different that you might not have tried before, but you need to have cheese and chives for the recipe. Here is the recipe: https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/recipes/a52582/bacon-egg-and-cheese-roll-ups-recipe/

That sounds very interesting and I've never heard of it before! I do have some cheese at home so that looks perfect! And it doesn't look like it takes long either. Do you think that this will be difficult to cook though?
I don't think that this will be difficult. In fact, this looks like a very easy recipe to make. What is about this recipe that you like?
Well, I like bacon and eggs, and I also love cheese, so it sounds perfect!
Of course, who doesn't like cheese! I'm glad that I could be of assistance today. It was very nice talking to you, and enjoy your breakfast!
Thank you, I'm glad that I spoke to you about this, I can't wait to try this! Thanks again!
Hi there, can you recommend anything good that I can make for my lunch today?

Hello! Of course, I can recommend something that you can cook. Do you have any dietary preferences or allergies? And what kind of food do you like to eat for lunch? Something light or something a bit more substantial. Also, are you looking for something quick to make, or are you thinking about something that takes a bit longer to make?

That's good to hear! I don't have any particular requirements or allergies, so no worries there! I don't really want to spend a lot of time on cooking and would really like something quite light that I can make quickly and then go. I like most kinds of food, but for lunch, I quite like sandwiches.

Okay, that's great! So, you want something quick to make like a sandwich, but maybe a little different? How much time are you looking to spend on this and what sort of food do you like? Do you like spicy food? Also, what kind of ingredients do you have at hand?

Yes, something a little different to the usual sandwiches I make. I am looking to spend between 20 and 40 minutes and yes, I like it spicy! I have a range of different ingredients at home, so it shouldn't be a problem with recipes.

That sounds like you really know what you like! Here is a nice variation of the steak sandwich recipe which only takes 40 minutes, but is totally worth it! Here is the recipe, it is for a steak and caramalised onion sandwich: https://www.olivemagazine.com/recipes/family/steak-and-buttered-onion-sandwich/
Okay, that isn't as spicy as I usually like it, but I do like steak, especially on a sandwich, and I have all those ingredients at home, so I'm willing to give it a go!

Ah yes, it maybe isn't as spicy as you like, but I would suggest you swap the mayonnaise and dijon mustard for some chutney and chilli sauce. I don't think that this will make much difference to the dish because the main ingredients are steak and onions. Sandwiches can be very versatile!
Yes, you're right! I usually follow recipes to the letter, but I can add any condiments I like. Great idea!
No problem, I'm glad you approve! Part of cooking is learning to customise your dishes to suit your own preferences. I'm glad to be of assistance in helping you decide what to make for your lunch!
I definitely approve, and it's been great to talk to someone who knows how to cater for different tastes! Thanks for the advice, I will get making that now.
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Trying to think of what I could cook for dinner tonight.
Do you have any dietary restrictions, or ingredients you want to avoid?
How about just a vegetarian dish tonight?
How skilled are you at cooking?
I'm pretty basic/unskilled. Not very experienced with cooking.
What do you usually cook?
Vegetable stuff, occasionally chicken.
Here's some delicious creamy mushroom pasta. Easy to make in only 25 minutes: https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/creamy-mushroom-spinach-pasta
Hm, I don't like this. Anything else?
How about this vegetarian pad thai? https://www.tasteofhome.com/recipes/vegetarian-pad-thai/
Sounds good. Anything else?
What else do you like or what are you looking for specifically?
How about something with chicken?
Thank you for allowing me to help you! It was great working on this together.
Great! Gonna try making one of these
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi there.
Hey there! Are you interested in breakfast, lunch, or dinner?
Hi, I'm interested in dinner right now.
Sure! Do you have any food allergies or dietary restrictions?
Yes. While I don't have any allergies, I am vegan.
Interesting, a vegan! May I inquire about how much cooking experience you have, and roughly how much time would you have to spend cooking dinner?

I would say I am an intermediate-level cook. I know how to use most kitchen cookware, and have cooked basic meals for myself for many years (rice, beans, broccoli, various stir fries, etc.). I think 30 minutes should be plenty to cook dinner.

Ok, I was about to ask you what you usually cook each week, but it seems like you cook beans, broccoli, rice, and various stir-fries. Given those are mostly ingredients, what kind of cuisine do you usually cook?
I usually cook Indian food since it's tasty and easy to make vegan. That is, I usually buy ready-made masala sauce, and stew various vegetables in it while making white rice with a rice cooker.

Excellent! I think I have a perfect recipe for you. Linked right here: https://www.wholesomelicious.com/indian-butter-cauliflower/ , it is a butter cauliflower Indian curry. The dish can be made in under 30 minutes (25 to be exact), and it goes perfectly with rice. Would you be interested in trying out the recipe?
Yes, I would love to try out this recipe. It seems delicious!
Great, I love that you're interested in the recipe. May I ask what specifically it is that interests you about this recipe?

First and foremost, it's vegan. It is a curry, which I love (curry is probably my favorite food). And last but not least, it seems relatively easy and simple to make -- very much within the limits of my cooking skills.
Awesome! It's been great to recommend a recipe for you that you're genuinely interested in trying. This conversation has been fun and illuminating! Talk to you later!
Yup, see ya
Hey there!
Hi! Welcome back! What are you interested in: breakfast, lunch, or dinner?
breakfast
Sound great! What kind of breakfast do you have in mind? What kinds of breakfast do you usually make for yourself?
I'm honestly really not sure. It has to be vegan, but honestly, I don't usually eat breakfast.

Ok! That's fine to not be sure. Let's start with what kind of timeframe you have for cooking this breakfast. Also, I know you're vegan, but what kind of breakfast cuisine are you looking for? That is, an American style (waffles, pancakes, etc.), a Chinese style (porridge, fried dough sticks, etc.), or something else?
I think breakfast should be nice and easy. Cooking time should be 15 minutes or less. As for the type, I don't really care -- it just has to be a light breakfast without too much food.

Sound good! What would you say to a coconut blueberry smoothie? The prep time is just around 5 minutes, it's light and simple, and of course, it's vegan! https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/280739/coconut-blueberry-smoothie/
Honestly sounds great! I'd love to start the morning with this!
Awesome! I love that you think it sounds great. Can you tell me specifically what appeals to you about this recipe?
Yeah. It's simple, easy to make, light so it's not a heavy amount of food, and it's vegan. Everything that I need in a breakfast.
Awesome! I love that we are 2 for 2 in recipe recommendations that you like! I think this concludes our interaction here. Talk to you soon!
yup, see you soon!
hey!
Hi again! What would you like to make today? Breakfast, lunch, or dinner?
lunch!

Sound great! How much time do you have to cook this lunch? I know from our previous interactions that you're vegan, so that's probably going to be the dietary restriction here. What do you usually cook for lunch, and what kinds of cuisines do you enjoy for lunch? Are there ingredients that you might not be able to get this time of year?

I think 20 minutes for lunch is plenty. I like to make a relatively simple lunch that is still filling. Besides being vegan, I really don't have any preferences. As you know, I love Indian food, and I also enjoy Chinese food. There are no typical ingredients that are out of my reach, but exotic ones might be tough to find, so let's stick to simple ingredients.
Sound good! I think 20 minutes to create a simple vegan lunch is more than enough. What types of dishes do you usually cook for lunch? Are there seasonal ingredients that you prefer?
I usually make Indian curries for lunch, but light curries that are relatively simple. I work at home, so smell isn't a big issue, and I don't really have any preferences for seasonal ingredients.

I think I've found the perfect recipe for you here: https://holycowvegan.net/20-minute-vegetable-curry-recipe/ What do you think? Would you like to try this recipe? It's light, quick, and under 20 minutes to make from scratch, and vegan.
Wow, this recipe looks great! Vegetable curries are my favorite.
Great! What specifically do you enjoy about vegetable curries? Why do you prefer this type of curry over other curries?

I think vegetable curries are light, but still retain a ton of curry flavor. They are also relatively soupy and creamy while still being vegan (no need for cream/milk), so they go great with white rice. It's the perfect texture for me.
Awesome. Anything else you want to tell me?
nope, that's it from me!

ingredient_availability: Exotic ingredients might be tough to find

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, I'm thinking of having chicken and stuffing with roast potatoes and gravy tonight
That sounds nice, do you have any allergies like gluten or dairy that should be avoided?
I don't have allergies as such, but I do have lactose intolerance.
Are you an experienced cook or a beginner? How much time do you have to prepare this meal?
I have some cooking experience, but I don't like to spend more than 1 hour over preparing meals.

I know what you mean! So do you prepare your own meals often or do you buy ready meals sometimes? There are various gluten and dairy free options available now in the supermarkets (like dairy-free gravy mix) which can help in this recipe.
Yes I do a mixture, sometimes quick ready meals, sometimes prepared myself.

Ok that's good thanks.  I have found a recipe that should be suitable for you here:

https://feedyourfamilytonight.com/chicken-and-stuffing-bake/

You can substitute the butter for olive oil and it can be cooked in 45min-1 hour.  Let me know what you think and hope you enjoy it! That's without the roast potatoes, but you can easily add those in the oven at the same time using store bought dairy free options like McCain Triple cooked Roast potatoes from Tesco (vegetable oil instead of butter)
Oh wow that's a nice recipe thanks!  It looks fairly easy to prepare and the store bought roast potatoes are a good idea to save time.

Glad you like it!  You can often substitute vegetable oils or plant milk for dairy in most recipes that you find online or in a book, so you don't have to miss out in future! Is there anything else I can help you with today? Are there any other recipes you would like help with?
No I think that's fine, I'll get on with making this for tonight!  Thanks a lot for your help!
It was nice chatting to you, hope to speak to you again soon!
Your welcome!

dish_like: chicken and stuffing with roast potatoes and gravy

dialogue.message: Hi, how are you today?  What can I have for breakfast?
(Hi, I am good thanks!  What do you fancy today, do you have much time to cook or something quick?
I don't have much time, something quick please.
What do you prefer, fruit, dairy or baked items?  Do you have any dietary restrictions at all?
I prefer fruit in the morning, so no real allergies there.

Ok, how's this for a delicious fruit dish:

https://www.theconsciousplantkitchen.com/breakfast-fruit-salad/

It's just fruit and very healthy options.
That looks delicious thanks!  It looks easy to prepare, I'll give it a try.
Glad you like it!  Are there any other ideas you'd like for breakfast?
Maybe tomorrow but I'll stick with this today thanks.
Glad I could help, look forward to speaking to you again soon!
Thanks bye!
Hi, do you have any ideas for lunch today?
Hi, what do you fancy, something quick or more filling?  Do you have any restrictions for ingredients? Cooked or cold?
Hi, I was thinking of a toasted sandwich with meat (ham, chicken or beef). No dietary restrictions.
I know just the thing!  How about a grilled chicken and avocado sandwich?  It's a filling and healthy option for you!
That sounds really nice.

Here is a good recipe for you:

https://www.greatbritishchefs.com/recipes/chicken-and-avocado-sandwich-recipe

What flavour combos do you like with avocado?
That sounds really tasty, I will give it a try!  I like any meat with avocado, and sometimes spinach or watercress with it as well.
That sounds really healthy!  Let me know if you want any further ideas.
I will thanks!
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi - I hope you can help me!
We will do what we can - please tell me what meal you are interested in making?
I'm making a dinner for two people
Excellent. Is it a special occasion or just a normal dinner?
I am making it for a friend who I havent seen for a while
Ok that sounds good. Do you or your friend have any dietary needs we should know about?
My friend is vegetarian and had a lentil allergy so nothing with meat or lentils please
Ok. Would you describe yourself as a novice, average or advanced cook?
Oh I'm a novice
Excellent. We will keep the meal short and simple to make but include plenty of flavour so you can wow your guest. What kind of food do you and your guest like the most?
We both like asian fusion style dishes

Ok that sounds great. How about some deep fried tofu with sticky rice? Here is a great recipe for you 
https://www.bowlofdelicious.com/fried-rice-with-crispy-tofu/
That does look really good
What is it that stands out most to you about this recipe? The ingredients, the flavours, the simplicity?
How easy it is to make and I already have most of those things in the house
You will be cooking up a storm in no time! Thank you for your feedback. Enjoy your meal!
Thanks for your help
Hi there - I'm looking for some help to make a breakfast

Hi! Sounds great I hope we can help. How long do you have to cook your meal? Do you have a speciality or is this your first time? Is there anything you would like to include or anything you dont enjoy? Is there anything seasonal you would like? Are there any dietary restrictions?
I have about 30 minutes. Usually I make a smoked salmon bagel but I want to do something different. Maybe with eggs this time? Happy to include anything and no dietary restrictions

We know you are a big fan of Asian Fusion food and are just starting out on your cooking journey. How does a breakfast that includes eggs with an Asian style to it sound? I'm sure it will be easy to prepare and taste great!
That sounds really good - what can you recommend?
Do you have a specific preference when it comes to Asian Fusion breakfast? Is it something you are quite curious about?
I like vegetables like bok choi and onions. I think its much tastier and healthier than a standard cooked breakfast

Thanks for sharing that with us. Healthy and tasty is the best combination. We recommend trying this:
https://myfoodbook.com.au/recipes/show/asian-style-scrambled-eggs

Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi i need help decideing what to make for dinner.
Sure I can help with that. Do you have any allergies or restrictions I should be aware of?
No restrictions although vegetables are not my favorite.
Ok I can work with that. Are you experienced in the kitchen or do you keep things simple?
I know my way around the kitchen but Im not and expert.
Do you have a preferred cuisine? What do you usually cook at home?
I like American and chinese. I am good with most meats and can cook some fish.

How About this? 
HONEY SESAME CHICKEN
Sauce:

    ⅓ cup raw honey

    3 tablespoons tomato paste

    1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar

    1 tablespoon Sriracha sauce

    1 teaspoon sesame oil

    ½ cup cold water

    1 tablespoon cornstarch

    ½ teaspoon salt

Chicken:

    1 ¼ teaspoons salt, divided

    ¾ teaspoon garlic powder, divided

    1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces

    1 egg

    ¾ cup all-purpose flour

    ½ cup cold water

    ½ cup cornstarch

    2 tablespoons avocado oil

    1 ½ teaspoons baking powder

    peanut oil for frying

    ½ tablespoon toasted sesame seeds

Directions

    Mix honey, tomato paste, apple cider vinegar, Sriracha sauce, and sesame oil together in a medium bowl.

    Combine cold water, cornstarch, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a bowl; mix well. Add to honey sauce mixture and mix well. Set aside until needed.

    Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder over chicken.

    Whisk egg in a large bowl. Add remaining salt and garlic powder and mix well. Mix in flour. Combine water and cornstarch in a bowl; add to egg mixture and mix well. Add avocado oil and baking powder; mix well.

    Pour 3 inches of peanut oil into the bottom of a wide, deep pot and heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

    Place 1/2 of the chicken pieces into the batter mixture and turn to coat. Scoop tablespoonfuls of chicken and batter into the hot oil. Do not crowd the chicken. Fry in batches until chicken pieces are golden brown and no longer pink in the centers, about 1 minute per side. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Check oil temperature between batches.

    Pour honey sauce mixture into a large skillet. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, 3 to 4 minutes. Add all chicken pieces to the sauce; turn to coat. Sprinkle on sesame seeds.
Oh tht sounds really good. That is definetly something I would try.

Perfect here is the link to that recipe. https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/275149/honey-sesame-chicken/

What do you like about this recipe? Would you like more like this?
I love honey and I love recipes that combine sweet an savory.

Thank you for all your help.
Hi can you help me with a breakfast reciepe?
Sure. Is this for any particular occasion? Do you have any breakfast preferences.
I like almost all breakfast food. Its my favorite food actually. Im not very fond of yellow cheese though so I dont want anything with it.
ok do you have any specific goals when it comes to breakfast? Would you like high protein or low calorie suggestions?
I feel like breakfast should be a little indulgent. I  like sweet and savory when it comes to breakfast as well.

Since you are a fan of sweet and savory how about a classic?
Heres the link 
https://damndelicious.net/2023/05/19/honey-fried-chicken-and-waffles/
Honey Fried Chicken and Waffles
Ingredients
for the buttermilk waffles

    2 cups all-purpose flour
    1 tablespoon sugar
    2 teaspoons baking powder
    ¾ teaspoon baking soda
    1 teaspoon kosher salt
    1 ⅔ cups buttermilk
    2 large eggs
    ¼ cup unsalted butter, melted

for the chicken

    1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour
    1 cup yellow cornmeal
    2 teaspoons baking powder
    1 teaspoon cayenne pepper
    Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
    2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks
    2 cups buttermilk
    6 cups vegetable oil
    ¼ cup honey, warmed

Instructions
for the buttermilk waffles

    Preheat oven to 200 degrees F and a waffle iron to medium-high heat. Lightly oil the top and bottom of the waffle iron or coat with nonstick spray.
    In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
    In a large glass measuring cup or another bowl, whisk together buttermilk, eggs and butter. Pour mixture over dry ingredients and stir using a rubber spatula just until moist.
    Pour a scant 1/2 cup of the buttermilk mixture into the waffle iron, close gently and cook until golden brown and crisp, about 4-5 minutes; keep warm in oven.

for the chicken

    In a large bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder, cayenne pepper, 2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper.
    Working one at a time, dredge chicken in flour mixture, dip into buttermilk, then dredge again in flour mixture, pressing to coat.
    Heat vegetable oil in a large stockpot or Dutch oven over medium high heat until it registers 360 degrees F on a deep-fry thermometer.
    Working in batches, add chicken and fry until golden brown, turning occasionally, about 4-5 minutes. Transfer to a baking sheet fitted with a wire rack and keep warm.*
    Serve immediately with waffles, drizzled with honey.
Oh thats a great Idea. I have never tried to make it myself but I really love to order that at restaurants. I bet it will be fun to try.
What in particular do you enjoy about this recipe? Is this similar to what you normally cook?
Of course I love the sweet and savory. The cruch that comes with it puts this recipe over the top. I make fried chicken sometimes but I havent tried this before.
Thank you for letting me know your preferences.  Good luck with trying out this recipe I hope it is delicious!
Thank you I hope so too!
Hi I need an idea to cooke for lunch. Any suggestions?
Sure. What is a typical lunch for you? Are you looking for something new and different?
Something not to heavy. Usually a sandwhich or a sub. Maybe a really good salad.
Do you have any goals when it comes to lunch like low calorie? Is there anything you dont like?
I dont want lunch to be to fattening but It does not have to focus on super healthly. No pastas or something that will make me feel sluggish.

I know you like sweet and savory so how about this? here is the link. 
https://www.sugardishme.com/baked-honey-mustard-ham-sandwiches/
Baked Honey Mustard Ham Sandwiches
Ingredients
For the Sandwiches:

    1 package (of 12) sweet Hawaiian-style rolls
    1 1/2 pounds thick-sliced cooked ham, in small pieces
    1 1/2 cups shredded cheese (pictured: cheddar; also delicious: Swiss)

For the Honey Mustard:

    3 tablespoons Dijon mustard
    3 tablespoons honey
    1 tablespoon mayonnaise

For the Buttery Poppy Seed Sauce:

    1 tablespoon grated onion
    1 1/2 teaspoons poppy seeds
    1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
    1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
    4 tablespoons melted butter

Instructions

    Preheat the oven to 350. Line a baking sheet or dish with foil.
    Slice the rolls in half. Instead of breaking them apart, I just slice them as one big piece and pull them apart after baking.
    Mix together the mustard, honey, and mayonnaise to make the honey mustard. Spread the honey mustard on both sides of the bread.
    Layer the bread with the ham and cheese. Put the top half of the bread on top of the ham and cheese and place the whole thing on the prepared baking sheet.
    For me, the easiest way to make the Buttery Poppy Seed Sauce is to place all of the ingredients in a jar, screw on the lid, and shake until evenly combined.
    Pour the sauce over the sandwiches.
    Bake for 12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
    Serve warm.
That sounds really good and I can easily make enough to share with others!
Have you made something similar to this before? What excites you about this recipe?
I like that it is really simple and something that is easy to make a lot of and share. I think it will be really easy!
I am glad I could help. I really hope you enjoy this recipe.
Thank you I look forward to trying it.

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!

Thanks. Most of the family like spicy food. We eat Indian, Mexican or Thai but also Mediterranean flavours.
That's great. What about any allergies or dietary requirements for your family? Do I need to avoid any foods in the recipe?
No we are all happy to eat anything.
Are you an experienced cook or should I look for recipe ideas that don't require any advanced cooking skills? How long do you usually spend on cooking a family dinner?
I am a reasonable cook but have run out of ideas! About half an hours preparation would be about right, plus cooking time. Even better if it can be prepared in advance.
That's great. I will look for something for an experienced cook but with limited time to spend on preparation.
Super! Something a bit more adventurous but simple would be good.

How about Tandoori Chicken? It's really easy to prepare and can be left to marinate overnight and cook when needed in around 15 minutes. It's lovely served with rice and salad. Here is the recipe I suggest: https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/tandoori-chicken

How does that sound?
That sound really tasty and something the family would enjoy. Thank you.
I'm glad you think this would be a good recipe. What is it about this that you think the family would enjoy?
It looks nice and spicy but healthy too. I think it would also work well on a barbeque.
Sounds good! I love a BBQ too. Hope you enjoy it. Please get back to me if you need anything else.
Thank you. You have been most helpful and I will contact you again for recipe inspiration.
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi there, that's great, thanks. I'm trying to think what to cook for dinner. Can you help?
I'm sure I can help you with that. What kind of meals do you like?
Great, thank you. I love Italian food.
That's an excellent choice! Let's try and help you with that. Do you have any dietary requirements or food intolerances?
No, I do not have any allergies or intolerances, thanks for asking.
Thats great news. Can I ask how you would like to prepare the food? What cooking appliances do you have?
I have a gas hob and an oven.
Brilliant, thank you. And how much time do you have to prepare a meal?
Not too long, maybe around 30 to 40 minutes.
That's is plenty of time, there are many recipes that I could help you with that you can prepare during that time.  What sort of protein would you like in your meal?
Minced beef please
An excellent choice! There are many options available! How about a nice Spaghetti Bolognese?

I'm glad you like my suggestion, I'm sure it will taste amazing. Would you like me to send a recipe link?

Certainly. Are you looking for a hot or cold breakfast?

Are you looking for an Italian inspired breakfast too?

My pleasure! Which bit of it stands out the most? Any information you can provide will certainly help me when tailoring other choices for you in the future, ensuring that I provide the most suitable recipes for you that I know you'll love.
I think that it's because it uses sourdough, which is my favourite type of bread.

That's really helpful thank you! I'll be sure to consider sourdough when suggesting other recipes in the future. I'm glad that I have been able to help you out today. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
No, I think that's it thank you. Bye!

Hi, I need to think of something to cook for dinner. I have chicken thighs, potatoes and broccoli. Any ideas?

Excellent! Are there any other details that I need to take into account? I know that you already have chicken, potatoes and broccoli but are there any other ingredients you have that, for example, need using up? I might be able to incorporate them so they're not wasted.

I don't think so. It's just an ordinary evening meal for 2. I have half a bottle of white wine and some mushrooms that need using up but I'm about to go shopping so I can get pretty much anything else later.

Based on your requirements I have found a recipe for Chicken in White Wine Sauce with Mushrooms. I would recommend mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli as side dishes. Please visit the following link for additional ingredients. Happy cooking! 

https://www.kitchensanctuary.com/chicken-with-creamy-white-wine-garlic-sauce/ If you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask!

I'm so happy to hear it! Was there anything you particularly liked about this recommendation? This will help me to give more accurate recommendations in the future.
I just liked the fact that it uses things I already have. I'm not a fan of food waste!
Thank you so much for your positive feedback! It has been a pleasure to assist you and if there's anything else you would like to ask me, I will be more than happy to help! Bon apetit!

You've been very helpful and thanks very much! Hope you have a good day too.

Thanks for the information!

The first thing that comes to mind is the classic club sandwich. It's easy and quick to prepare, uses common ingredients, including the chicken you already have on hand, and tastes great!

Here's an example of a typical recipe:

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/club-sandwich

In that case, I think I would recommend a Ploghman's sandwich. It is similar to a club sandwich, but has a much more powerful taste due to the addition of mature cheddar and a strong pickle.

Here's a good recipe for you to try:

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/ploughmans-sandwich

I really glad I could help.

May I ask what it is specifically you find appealing about my suggestion and if there's anything in particular you are looking forward to tasting?
You can! A nice strong cheddar coupled with pickle just feels right at the moment. I want something with a strong flavour that's also quick and easy to prepare, so a Ploughman's is perfect.

I am so glad I could help! If there's anything else I can help you with, please let me know.

Thank you and have a great day!
Thanks for your help

So, I don't really have any dietary restrictions, I'm happy with a hot or cold breakfast the main thing is that I like to lie in in the mornings, so what ever it is needs to be quick to make.

So, based on what you've said I think you should have a go at making overnight oats. you can personalise it with what ever fruit you like the most, there's plenty of complex carbohydrate to give you an energy boost in the morning and best of all, you prepare it the night before and leave it in the fridge, so all you have to do is sit back and enjoy eating it. Here's a link to a recipe, have   a look and let me know what you think.

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/overnight-oats

I think I'll try a few different things, I love mango though, I think  I'll try that first.
Ooh! I really like the sound of that. Well, I hope you enjoy your breakfast. Don't forget, I'm always here if you need help or any new meal ideas.
I will do, thanks again.

Ok, I'm going to throw you a bit of a curveball here, I hope you can trust me.

Have you ever tried vichyssoise? its essentially a cold, smooth, creamy leek and potato soup, It might sound odd but its really delicious and sounds completely different to what you've been having for lunch. Here's a link to a recipe.

https://www.greatbritishchefs.com/recipes/vichyssoise-recipe

No, I've heard of gazpacho but I've never tried it. I love leek and potato soup, I would imagine having it chilled makes it very different indeed!

Well I'm glad you can trust me, I must say, it's good to talk to someone who's adventurous with food, see if you can get some of your colleagues to try it when you take it into work. as always feel free to get in touch if you need any more ideas.
Will do! thanks again for your help.

Chicken Breast Wrapped in Bacon
Ingredients
2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

4 slices bacon

1 (12 ounce) bottle barbecue sauce, or as needed

1 cup grated Cheddar cheese, or as needed

Directions
Fill a small saucepan with water, add chicken, and bring to a boil. Simmer and cook chicken for 10 minutes. Drain.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Wrap each chicken breast with 2 slices of bacon and place in an ovenproof baking dish. Cover with barbecue sauce. Sprinkle with grated Cheddar cheese.

Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is bubbly and chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 12 minutes.

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Oh , perfect. I'm struggling to think of what to make for dinner this week.
Do you have any special dietary restrictions or do you follow a diet like Paleo or vegetarian that I should be aware of before making suggestions?
No, not really. I don't eat very much meat and I prefer to eat plant-based proteins. My teeth can be a little sensitive to cold... LOL
Do you have a lot of time to create meals or is it important that they be relatively quick and easy with minimal prep and cooking time?
I don't mind spending some time but I don't want to spend hours on it. Usually I can find 20-45 minutes for making dinner.
I understand you prefer plant-based proteins and have some time available to prep and cook dinners. Are you craving any specific ingredients or flavors this week?
I feel like Mexican or Southwest would be a good option for this week.

This is a Mexican recipe with plant-based protein that is expected to take 15 minutes to prep and cook. Do you think this recipe is one you would like t try? https://www.budgetbytes.com/hearty-black-bean-quesadillas/
Oh Budget Bytes is one of my favorite recipe blogs. How did you know?  And  I love that it's plant-based protein and  only takes  15 minutes .
What aspects of this recommendation are especially appealing to you (so I can learn for future requests)?

I like that it's Southwest or Mexican flavors. I like that it has plant-based protein. I like that it's from Budget Bytes because I trust Beth and because watching my food budget is very important to me.
Thank you so much for letting me know about your preferences. I'm glad the recommendation is going to fill the bill.
Are you able to help me put together a grocery list for this recipe?
Heya TaskMad, I'm trying to come up with a special breakfast recipe for Thursday this week because it's Thanksgiving Day.
Since it's a holiday, do you have more time to cook than usual or less time? I'm also wondering if you want to stick with the Mexican/Southwest theme for breakfast on Thanksgiving Day.
I will definitely have more time to cook and will want to make an effort since it's a special day. No, there is no need to stay with the Mexican/Southwest theme for Thanksgiving breakfast.

Taking into consideration your preference for minimal meat consumption and the fact that you will have more time available to cook than on a normal day, how does this recipe sound to you? https://www.budgetbytes.com/kale-swiss-and-mushroom-strata/
Oh TaskMad, this *could* work. The only thing is that I don't like mushrooms. Everything else sounds great and really perfect for the holiday.
Oh no! I understand not liking mushrooms. Sometimes they can be very slimy. How would you feel about subbing red peppers in for the mushrooms in this recipe and doing the rest of it as is?
I think that sounds like a really great idea.  Is this a recipe I will need to start the night before? Like tonight?
I'm glad that subbing out the mushrooms with red pepper slices will work for you. Yes, you will need to start preparing the strata tonight so that it can sit overnight.
Ok, I will start this recipe tonight.

time_availability: More time to cook on Thanksgiving Day
dish_like: Kale, Swiss, and Mushroom Strata without mushrooms
ingredient_like: Red peppers as a substitute for mushrooms
cuisine_dislike: No Mexican/Southwest theme for Thanksgiving breakfast

Um, not really? I don't like mayo or cream based sauces. Mostly tomato based for me.
Gotcha. That's pretty common. A lot of people don't like Alfredo sauces and whatnot. What is your general skill level with cooking and how much time do you have to prepare?
To be honest, I have almost no skill at cooking and only about an hour or so to make the food before my guest arrives.

Okay, we can work with that! So, you need a pretty quick pasta dish with a tomato based sauce that you can make in an hour or less with a simple salad using Italian dressing. Sound about right? Any other preferences or restrictions that I should be aware of before we start?
Yep! That's it. I have spaghetti noodles, tomato sauce, some ground beef, romaine lettuce, croutons, and italian dressing. Will that be enough to work with?

Great! Seems like you already have everything you need to make a delicious meal for yourself and your guest quickly. This recipe for meat spaghetti has gotten 5 stars from users and is very simple: https://tastesbetterfromscratch.com/homemade-spaghetti-sauce/. 

For the salad, I'd recommend a simple Caesar while substituting Italian for regular Caesar dressing based on your taste preference. 

How does that sound?
Perfect. Yeah. I can make this work, for sure. Does it matter that I just have tomato sauce instead of pizza sauce?
That'll be fine. Pizza sauce is functionally identical to pizza sauce anyway. If you have a little oregano and parmesan cheese, then you won't notice the difference.
Okay! Does it matter that I haven't soaked the noodles? Also, do I need to add salt when boiling them?

No, soaking noodles overnight is just a general piece of advice for making al dente pasta and isn't expected when putting together a meal in the short term. And adding salt to boiling water when making pasta is a bit of a myth. Some say that it can make it less sticky, but if you just boil it enough, then it shouldn't be an issue anyway. I do recommend that you add a spoonful of olive oil, though. It will both slicken the pasta and add a slight tang to it's flavor profile.
Awesome. Thank you.

Here is the ingredient f9or the soup-ngredients (serves 2-3)
½ pound beef brisket, cut into small pieces
½ pound Korean radish or daikon, washed and peeled
2 green onions, sliced thinly diagonally
4  garlic cloves, minced
1 tablespoon fish sauce (or soup soy sauce)
1 teaspoon kosher salt
7 cups waterBeef and radish soup is a very popular soup in Korea. The soup is non-spicy, so it’s a perfect choice for children, and it can be whipped up quickly if you have a lot of sudden guests. It’s hearty food best enjoyed with rice, and is a staple in the Korean diet.



This is an old recipe with a new video, part of my project to remake all of my old videos into higher quality HD and with original music so they can’t be blocked in some countries on copyright grounds.
Ingredients (serves 2-3)
½ pound beef brisket, cut into small pieces
½ pound Korean radish or daikon, washed and peeled
2 green onions, sliced thinly diagonally
4  garlic cloves, minced
1 tablespoon fish sauce (or soup soy sauce)
1 teaspoon kosher salt
7 cups water

Directions
Slice the radish thinly into bite size pieces about 1½ x 1½ inch and ¼ to 1/8 inch thick.
Put the radish and water into a pot. Cover and bring it to a boil over medium high heat for about 15 minutes.Add the beef and garlic. Turn down the heat to medium and cook for 25 minutes.Cook another 5 minutes and remove from the heat.
Ladle into a bowl. Serve with rice, kimchi, and more side dishes.

Ingredients:

I don't have any allergies. However, I do try to follow a low salt diet, so nothing too salty please!

That's fine, I will bear that in mind. Can you tell me what level of skill you have in the kitchen? Are you a beginner, or intermediate, or would you consider yourself an expert cook? Also, how much time do you have to prepare this dinner?
I'm probably an intermediate cook. I can do all the basics and follow a recipe, but nothing too difficult please. I have a couple of hours to prepare and cook the meal.

Thank you for that. Now, let's drill down into what kind of food you want to prepare. Could you tell me if you have any favourite dishes that you regularly cook or particular types of cuisine you especially enjoy? Are there any specific ingredients you would like to use or prefer to avoid? It would also be useful to know a little about the occasion - how many people you are cooking for, whether it is a special event, or if any potential guests have dietary requirements.

I'm cooking for my partner and me, so I want to make something romantic. We both love Italian food, so maybe something along those lines. It would be good to use chicken, as it is my partner's favourite food.

This is a great Italian chicken breast recipe. It's perfect for a romantic dinner for two and the tomato sauce has a beautiful blend of ingredients to create an authentic Italian flavour. Also, it takes just 30 minutes to prepare and cook, so you'll have plenty of time for a relaxing soak in the bath prior to your romantic evening! You can find the full recipe here https://delishably.com/meat-dishes/Chicken-Italian-For-Two-A-Romantic-Dinner-Option.
Hmm...I like it, but it seems like it could be a little simple. I want to impress my partner and I worry this might look a bit like I'm phoning it in.

No problem. If you want a more impressive recipe, then I recommend chicken cacciatore. It's full of flavour and uses chicken thighs that absorb all the juice until the meat melts in your mouth. It's still simple to prepare and only takes 50 minutes, but it tastes like you've been slaving over the stove all day! You can find the recipe here https://cafedelites.com/chicken-cacciatore/. Please provide some feedback on this recommendation so I can be sure I am giving the best possible service.
Oh, that's more like it. It looks really special and like I've put a lot of effort into making it.Thank you, you really listened to my requirements and helped me find the perfect dish.

Wonderful, I'm so pleased you like my recommendation. For future reference, you might try creamy Tuscan chicken for any future romantic dinners. It is perfect with pasta and a real authentic Italian treat. With the chicken cacciatore as well, your Italian repertoire will really impress your partner with your kitchen skills!
That's great. Thank you so much for your suggestions. I'm sure my partner will be very impressed!

Thank you for your feedback and for taking the time to engage with me and plan your romantic dinner. Have a wonderful evening and please let me know if there is anything I can help you with in the future.
Thank you for your help. Bye!

I have no allergies. I like cod, haddock, plaice and salmon. My favourite vegetables are broccoli, potatoes, carrots and peas
How experienced are you with cooking meals? How much time do you have for this task? do you like fried fish or other ways of cooking?
I've cooked before but am not very experienced. I have a couple hours spare to cook. I prefer boiled fish
What kind of weekly dishes do you usually eat? Any sauces or extras do you like with your fish & vegetables?
I like to have mainly fish meals with plenty vegetables. I like cheese & cream sauces, not spicy

Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, I'd like to get some ideas for my next evening meal.  Can you suggest something that is simple and quick to make?
Sure, I'm glad to help.  You could try a Spaghetti Bolognese. Its quick to make, tastes good and doesn't involve too much cooking.
That is a great idea, thanks for your help!
no problem, can I just check if you have any dietary requirements or have any food allergies?
no allergies, and no requirements, I can eat pretty much anything
how good would you say you are at cooking?  Also, how much time would you like to spend on this meal?
I'm quite good, I can cook a variety of things.  I'm pressed for time, about 30 mins, that's why I'm asking for some advice, thanks
great, can I ask if you cook different meals during the week?, and are there any foods that you prefer?
I stick to the basics really, and like most foods.  Pizza, pasta, curry and chips are my usual choices

Great, based on your choices I'd also like to recommend that you make a Margherita pizza.  Its a classic, and I'm sure you'd love to make one.  It doesn't take long to prepare and you could have one ready to eat in under 30 minutes.  Would you like to try a Margherita, or would you like to try something else.  Here is a link to a recipe to try   https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/pizza-margherita-4-easy-steps
That's great, really helpful!
Excellent, was the Margherita recipe helpful?, and is that why you want to try making one?
yes, the recipe was really helpful.  Easy to follow and sounds like it would be fun to make one, thanks
I'm pleased to hear it was helpful, and hope you have fun making the pizza!  Have a great day, bye!
Thanks, have a great one too!  bye
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Good afternoon, i'm looking for inspiration for dinner this evening
I can help you with that, before we start could you advise if you have any dietary restrictions or other elements I should consider? Is the meal just for yourself or for a wider audience?

Great! Absolutely no dietary restrictions, in fact quite the opposite - I am a very adventurous eater and love trying out new flavours. The meal tonight is just for myself, I have basic stocks - spices, herbs etc but am likely to need to shop for the key ingredients so they should ideally be available in a UK supermarket
Ok, just to clarify - this is a single portion meal, just for this evening right? Or would you like to batch cook and potentially freeze / store leftovers for future meals?

Yes after this evening i'm away for the week with work so would just like to focus on a single portion please. I should mention i'm going to the gym after work so if we could ensure it contains a good amount of protein that would be helpful
Ok no problem, i'm glad you mentioned the gym element as that really helps me focus in on specific recipes. Do you have a protein preference? Are you ok with red meat?

I am absolutely fine with any meat or fish, no real preference from my side - I do find that many gym focused recipes are chicken lead but I find plain chicken very boring so if you could inject some flavour that would be excellent, I am not a fan of bland food

Ok how would you feel about a veggie curry? This recipe contains many cupboard staples, which you suggested you already have so wouldn't require much from the supermarket. It also includes Cauliflower rice which I absolutely love. See what you think - https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/veggie-protein-chilli
Honestly that does sound very tasty, i'm not too convinced by the protein benefits of a fully veggie meal though, do you have anything with a meat included?

Ok I completely understand, in that case why don't we look at something a bit more exciting. This pie would be nice and warming on a winter evening and the chicken would give you plenty of protein, but balanced with lots of vegetables and crispy pastry
This honestly sounds delicious but looks like a very large portion for just a single person, could you find something smaller?

How about the following? It seems to meet your needs for a smaller portion, includes the protein you require and the ingredients will be easily obtainable in a small local supermarket. See what you think? https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/flattened-chicken-tomatoes-olives-capers

I'd recommend grabbing some pasta to accompany the meal to ensure you're not too hungry
This sounds delicious and would be great - exactly what I was after. Thank you so much for your help!
Is there a specific aspect that you particularly like about the meal? I'm so glad I could help!
The portion size, protein element and the addition of the capers would really make the meal kick - It just sounds delicious
I really appreciate the feedback. Good luck with your cooking and I hope you have a fantastic weekend
You too, thanks

ingredient_availability: Ingredients should be available in a UK supermarket
skill_level: Basic stocks of spices, herbs etc.

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
My boyfriends parents are coming over tonight for dinner and I still dont know what to cook and his mom has a peanut allergy
I am happy to assist you with this predicament! Before we begin are there any other allergies or dietary restrictions to consider?
No she is only allergic to peanuts I was hoping to make a seafood dish or pasta but I feel that is still too simple

No problem I am here to solution this for you. Would you classify yourself as a beginner, at home cook or expert in the kitchen.  How much time do you have to cook this meal. Knowing this can allow me to find you the perfect recipe for your dinner.

I am a home cook it is a small hobby of mine but I am far from being professional. Dinner is at 7pm tonight and it is currently 1:35. I also need  to buy the groceries in case I do not have all the ingridients

You mentioned seafood and pasta being your main interest for tonight's route. Following this route what are your preference for a good meal is it spicy, savory, sweet, salty. Are you willing to bake or fry certain foods or are you trying to stay on the stove top. If you could send me a list of your wants and what you currently have, I can start organizing a list for you.

We all enjoy a kick to our food so something that is spicy or spicy sweet would be perfect. I do want a recipe that is low in salt. I want to stick with using my stovetop for now. I have an array of vegtables, short ribs, salmon, chicken breast, panco crumbs, eggs and various staples.

https://chefsavvy.com/honey-sriracha-salmon/#recipe This honey siracha salmon sounds like the perfect dish. It has a sweet spicy sauce that uses low sodium versions, so your dish is not salty. As a side an array of the vegetables you have now makes for a hearty meal. It is a meal you can build upon .
While I do like the idea of a honey glaze salmon I am not a fan of the taste siracha has. A better recipe would not include that for my personal taste.

Understandable we all have different taste. Thats why this https://somethingnutritiousblog.com/sweet-chili-salmon-bites/ recipe is a better fit. Meets all criteria and doesn't have any siracha in it. The salmon are cut into cubes creating a salmon bowl atop rice. It uses the same ingredients and replaces all you disliked about the other.
Much better I think I will be going with this salmon bowl idea. It is not too messy and gives me enough to cook a meal with an aesthetic look that is low maintencnce

To improve how I can better assist you in the future could tell me why you find the salmon bowl better and how it is more aesthetically pleasing. Are there any other preferences that could have made this recipe better.

The salmon bowl sounds as if it took more effort than the regular glazed salmon.  It also looked like a fun way to eat it and try things different like wrapping the salmon with rice for a perfect bite. I enjoy crunchy and different textures together when eating my meals.
Thank you for your time in writing me feedback. I appreciate all comments and look forward to assisting your future needs. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
No there is not thanks
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Thank you!
Hi! Are you interested in breakfast, lunch or dinner recipes?
I'm interested in breakfast recipes, please!
Great! Do you have any allergies that I should take into account before finding recipes for you? Also, do you have any preferences when it comes to cuisine?
I'm vegan so i only want vegan recipes, thanks! I don't have any preferences about cuisine though, surprise me!
Great to hear that you're vegan. Do you have any allergies that i should take into account, or is just the veganism that is important? Thanks
I have no allergies. Thanks
Could you let me know your preferences when it comes to making the food. Do you have a time limit, or preference for how long the recipe takes to make? And should the recipe be easy or harder?
I love to cook so i don't mind more complicated recipes, but i want to keep the cooking time under an hour if possible
What kind of dishes do you cook each week for breakfast? What flavours do you enjoy?
I eat a lot of things on toast like scrambled tofu, tomatoes etc and i enjoy savoury recipes, but i'm open to new options too. I love spices and flavourful food.

I've found this recipe for you. You said you preferred savoury food and flavourful food, and of course the recipe needs to be vegan. This is a savoury chickpea omelette, and is super easy and quick to prepare.https://www.theconsciousplantkitchen.com/chickpea-omelette/. Do you want to try the recipe?
That sounds great, thanks so much!
Why does this recipe appeal to you? Is there a specific reason you'd like to try it?
So the fact it's both quick to make and prepare is great, and i like that it's savoury not sweet

Thank you so much for the feedback and explanation, i appreciate it! It's great to hear you like the recipe i found. I hope you have a great time making and enjoying your breakfast. Have a wonderful day!
Thanks

dish_like: things on toast like scrambled tofu, tomatoes

dialogue.message: Hi
Hi! Are you looking for breakfast, dinner or lunch recipes?
I'm looking for dinner recipes

What kind of dishes do you enjoy cooking for dinner each week? Do you enjoy specific cuisines or flavours, or even ingredients you love to cook with? What dietary preferences do you have if any? Thanks
So i love cooking mexican food and just food that has a lot of spice in general. I'm vegan but have no other dietary concerns. I love cooking with veggies and vegan meat alternatives.

So i found you a burrito bowl recipe that incorporates veggies and 'meat'. It's mexican and has spice and sounds delicious! It has slaw, beans and a yummy dressing too. It's vegan, of course! Is this recipe okay for you?https://www.lazycatkitchen.com/vegan-chicken-burrito-bowl/
That recipe sounds perfect! I love the sound of all of the elements in the bowl. Thank you so much!
What are you most excited about trying, which element is your favourite? Are there any particular ingredients you are excited by?
I'm excited by the dressing as i like avocado and lime together, it reminds me of guacamole. I'm also excited by the spice in the recipe.
I'm glad you are excited to try the recipe! Thank you so much for the feedback and have a great day!
Thanks, you too

dialogue.message: Hi!
Hi! What meal are you looking for recipes for? Breakfast, lunch or dinner?
I'm looking for delicious lunch recipes

Okay, great! Are you looking for quick and easy recipes or do you want something more complex? How long do you have to cook? What meals do you usually enjoy at lunch, do you have any specific ingredients or meals you like?

I'm looking for a more impressive recipe and something more complex than my usual sandwiches or salads! I'm ideally looking for something with a cooking time of under an hour, but prep time can be as long as needed. I love using vegetables and vegan meats, and i enjoy foods with spice.

I've found you a curry recipe you might enjoy! It uses veggies and vegan chicken, and it has some heat to it. The cooking time is quick, but it looks like a delicious recipe. https://holycowvegan.net/easy-vegan-chickn-curry-with-potatoes-and-coconut-milk-one-pot-30-minutes/

What about this one? https://www.gousto.co.uk/cookbook/recipes/meat-free-chicken-jalfrezi-jeera-rice Jalfrezi is known for spice, and it still incorporates veggies, vegan meat and other great ingredients.
That sounds better, thanks so much!
What specifically appeals to you about this recipe? Is it the spice level, or the ingredients, or something else?
The spice level is most appealing as i wanted something spicy, but i also like the veggies and vegan meat,. I also like how easy it is to follow the instructions.
Thank you so much for explaining that to me. I'm so glad i was able to find you a recipe you will love! Have a great day and feel free to reach out again if you need more help.
Will do! Thanks

skill_level: more complex than usual sandwiches or salads
time_availability: cooking time of under an hour

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!

No allergies, I eat meat and everything else. I would like something based on chicken and have a good carbohydrate like pasta or rice or potatoes

I am not an expert but I know how to make a wide range of things. Intermiedate. Any time is fine, maybe not longer than 3 hours

I cook pasta, italian dishes, rice, chicken, burgers. I don't like boiled vegetables or broccoli or cauliflower. No raw onions or mushrooms. I like noodles, pasta, most meat

I recommend a recipe that features chicken and a good carbohydrate, such as pasta, rice, or potatoes. A nice pasta dish would suit your time preference such as the creamy sun dried tomato recipe you can find here: https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/creamy-sun-dried-tomato-chicken-pasta/

I like asian inspired dishes, stir fry and sweet and spicy

Here is a sweet chilli chicken stir fry I think you will love: https://vjcooks.com/sweet-chilli-chicken-noodles/ 
Thank you for your interaction and have a great cooking experience.
That is perfect thank you

ingredient_like: good carbohydrate like pasta or rice or potatoes

What is your time availability for cooking? Also, the types of dishes you frequently cook for breakfast each week, your current cuisine preferences, whether you are cooking for yourself or others, any health goals or dietary restrictions they have, and the specific ingredients they currently have on hand?

Usually in the morning I like something quick so under 30 minutes. I usually eat eggs and like doing so, but not fried eggs. Some sort of carb like bread or potato maybe. It's usually me or me and my boyfriend. No allergies or new restrictions. I have eggs, some assorted veg, some bread in the freezer, cheese etc
I recommend this recipe for a baked egg in a bagel. It's quick, easy and a bit different: https://sailorbailey.com/blog/15-minute-bagel-nests/
That looks perfect and so fun, thanks
Can I ask why the recommended recipe looks perfect and fun? Are you sure it meets your preference for quick and easy breakfast options?
I love bagels and have been meaning to make them myself. It also says under 15 minutes which is perfect
Thanks for the feedback! I hope you enjoy your new recipe
No problem
Hello, finally I would like a recipe to make for lunch tomorrow for me and my 2 friends
Any time restrictions, or new cuisines you would like to mention? Any new allergies or preferences you would like to make me aware about?
No restrictions, I am happy to be cooking for a few hours. No allergies, we all like the same things really.  Maybe something with fish as I have a nice market nearby.
How about this baked salmon recipe? It looks easy and quick and sure to be a crowd pleaser: https://www.kitchensanctuary.com/honey-garlic-butter-baked-salmon/
It looks good but maybe something a bit more unique? Maybe with some Thai flavours

No problem. How about this? https://thehappyfoodie.co.uk/recipes/mary-berrys-roasting-tin-thai-salmon-and-vegetables/ 
It looks more complex and you could pair it with some stir fried veggies like in this recipe https://www.thespruceeats.com/garlic-ginger-lime-stir-fried-noodles-3217200
That looks great, I have some ginger in the fridge I need to use
Any other preferences you have in mind? Are you happy with those recommendations?
Nope, I am happy with them, they look perfect. I think I have all the spices mentioned.
Thanks for your cooperation. I hope you enjoy the meal with your friends
No problem! Thank you

I'm thinking of cooking Chicken Piccata. I would like to cook Chicken Piccata for dinner. Could you help me with that?
Do you have any food allergies or dietary requirements that need to be taken into consideration for the Chicken Piccata recipe?
I don't have any allergies.
May I know your skill level in cooking and your time availability for preparing the Chicken Piccata for dinner?
I'm good at cooking and I have lots of free time tonight.

Hey there! Planning your weekly eats? Tell me, what kind of dishes do you usually crave during the week? Any specific cuisine, ingredients, or maybe something seasonal you're into right now? And hey, who's joining you for these delicious meals? Any preferences or special occasions to consider?
I like Mediterranean cuisine. I will be with my girlfriend.

Planning to cook up something special for your girlfriend? How about a Mediterranean delight – Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken with a side of Greek Salad? It's a flavor explosion! Check out this recipe: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken with Greek Salad, https://cafedelites.com/grilled-lemon-herb-mediterranean-chicken-salad-recipe/ .What do you think? Give it a shot, and let me know how it turns out!

Hey, what caught your eye about the Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken with Greek Salad recipe? Was it the fresh Mediterranean vibe, the zesty lemon and herb combo, or maybe the idea of impressing your girlfriend with a flavorful dish? Tell me more about what you're looking forward to.
I'm all about those Mediterranean flavors. Plus, my girlfriend loves anything with a fresh and vibrant twist.

Awesome! Thanks for sharing your preferences and giving the Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken with Greek Salad a shot. Cooking can be such a delightful experience, especially when it's for someone special. Enjoy the process, and I hope you and your girlfriend have a fantastic time savoring the delicious outcome!
Thanks a bunch! I'm really looking forward to trying out the Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken with Greek Salad.

I am thinking of cooking chinese food for dinner. Do you have any suggestions?
Do you have any food allergies?
No I don't.
How would you gauge your cooking skills from 1 to 10 with 1 being no experience and 10 being highly experienced. Also, what time would you like to serve dinner?
I would say I am around 8. I would like to serve dinner around 7pm but I will be free all day.
What types of dishes they frequently cook each week and what is your cuisine preferences? This is to help me gauge an appropriate recipe for you later.
I usually cook pasta. Italian food. However, I do like to branch out to different cuisines to change things up a bit. I love to cook and learn.

Based on your answers. I found this unique and interesting Chinese food recipe that I think you will enjoy making. It's also very delicious. It's called Mongolian beef and spring onion. It has a peer review of 4.6 stars out of 5.  https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/201849/mongolian-beef-and-spring-onions/

I am glad you like it. What specifically about the strong flavors and the newness of the dish appeals to you?
First the image of the dish looks appetizing. Second, the texture and consistency of the dish looks very pleasing to the palates. I also love the use of brown sugar and garlic.
I am very happy to be of assistance. I wish you the best and hope you have a wonderful time and experience at making this dish.
Thank you very much! You were very helpful! Take care

I'm looking for a recipe for dinner No allergies or anything, but it has to be halal, so can't be pork or have any alcohol in it
