dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, I'm looking for suggestions on what to make for my dinner, can you help?
I am able to help you but need to find out a little bit about your preferences first. Let's start with what kinds of food do you like?
I like Italian, Indian or French food.
These are popular choices but before making a suggestion I need to know if you have any food allergies?
No, I have no food allergies.
Are there any types of food that you dislike and do you have any other requirements?
I don't like fish and I would like the meal to be budget friendly.
Do you already have any ingredients at home?
Yes, I have tinned tomatoes .
I would suggest using the tinned tomatoes to create an Italian dish. Would you like an Italian recipe using your tomatoes?
Yes , that sounds good.

I suggest the following Italian recipe 
https://www.foodandwine.com/recipes/tomato-sauce-onion-and-butter

This uses only three ingredients and pasta. It is highly rated and uses your tomatoes.
That looks delicious, I'll give it a try.
Is there any other recipe I can help you with?
No thanks, that's all I need at the moment.
Enjoy your dinner. Can I help you with anything else?
Yes, actually I've just realised that I have broccoli in the fridge that I need to use. Can you give me a recipe for this?
How do you like your broccoli cooked and should it be used in an Italian recipe?
Yes Italian, I like my broccoli to be cooked so that it still has some crunch.
I suggest the following https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/281281/one-pot-lemon-broccoli-pasta-with-parmesan/
That looks good but I don't have any lemons. Do you have another suggestion?
The following recipe does not require lemons and will ensure that your broccoli still has bite. https://thehappyfoodie.co.uk/recipes/broccoli-and-parmesan-pasta/
That looks good, does it require eggs?
This recipe requires three eggs. Do you want a recipe that does not include eggs?
Eggs are fine but I only have one left. Give me another recipe please.
I have found another recipe but this includes chillies. Do you like spicy food?
Yes I do. Lets see what you have.
here is a recipe https://www.anediblemosaic.com/spicy-garlic-broccoli-italian-broccoli/
Yes that is the one.

I eat lots of Mexican food and am pretty good at cooking it myself, how about a beef chili recipe?   It's getting cold here now.

Thank you for you input,  it has been a pleasure assisting you.  Have a great day! The Best Classic Chili – This traditional chili recipe is just like mom used to make with ground beef, beans, and a simple homemade blend of chili seasonings.

The Best Classic Chili recipe in a red bowl topped with cheese and sour cream
This classic chili is perfect for a weeknight meal because it can be made in minutes.  The only thing to chop is an onion.

How do you make good homemade chili?
Heat olive in a large soup pot. 
Add chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes.
Add ground beef and break it apart with a wooden spoon.
Cook for 6-7 minutes.
onions and ground beef sautéing in a soup pot
Add chili powder, cumin, sugar, tomato paste, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and optional cayenne. 
Stir until well combined.
chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, sugar, salt, and pepper over browned beef and onions in a pot
Add diced tomatoes, kidney beans, beef broth, and tomato sauce. 
Stir well.
diced tomatoes over chili seasoned ground beef and onions in a soup pot
Simmer for 20-25 minutes.
Let the chili rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.
That looks great!   what do you recommend I top it with
Hello Assistant!   what do you recommend for breakfast tomorrow?

How much time do you have for breakfast?
Do you have any dietary restrictions or health goals I should know about?
No, I do not have any health goals or dietary restrictions.  And I am not in a big hurry in the morning.
What do you normally have for breakfast?   Do you have any cuisine preferences?   And are there any ingredients you have on hand?
I usually just make a quick bowl of oatmeal, but I can cook more complicated things and my kitchen is fully stocked.

How about a Spanish Omelet?  with hash browns and a side of mixed fruit?

Heat up the olive oil in a really hot pan.
Thinly slice the onion.
Slice the potatoes into 3-millimeters thick pieces.
Fry the vegetables in the olive oil over high heat for 10-15 minutes until they caramelize.
Drain the vegetables and save the olive oil for later use.
Add 6 eggs to a bowl and whisk. Add the fried vegetables, stir, and leave to set for 15-20 minutes.
In a nonstick pan, fry the egg mixture over high heat for 1 minute, then reduce to a low heat for 2-4 minutes.
Cover the pan with a large plate and carefully turn the omelet out onto the plate.
Slide the omelet back into the pan and fry for a further 3-5 minutes over low heat. To check the omelet is cooked, gently press on the centre of the omelet. If the surface springs back, it is ready.
Repeat step 8 to remove omelet from the pan.
Enjoy!
https://tasty.co/recipe/spanish-omelette

Hash Browns
2 medium russet potatoes, shredded
½ medium onion, finely chopped
¼ cup all-purpose flour
1 egg
1 cup oil for frying, or as needed
salt and pepper to taste
Gather all ingredients.

Rinse shredded potatoes until water is clear, then drain and squeeze dry.
Place shreds in a bowl and mix in the onion, flour, and egg until evenly distributed.
Heat about 1/4 inch of oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. When oil is sizzling hot, place potatoes into the pan in a 1/2 inch thick layer. Cover the whole bottom of the pan, or make separate piles like pancakes.
Cook until nicely browned on the bottom, then flip over and brown on the other side. It should take at least 5 minutes per side. If you are cooking them in one big piece, it can be cut into quarters for easier flipping.
Remove from pan, and drain on paper towels. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
Serve hot and enjoy!
https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/57783/emilys-famous-hash-browns/

How about beef or cheese enchiladas or burritos?
with rice and beans.
Beef Enchiladas
Ingredients
SPICE MIX
▢1 tsp each onion & garlic powder (Note 1)
▢1 tbsp each cumin powder, paprika and dried oregano
▢1/2 – 1 tsp cayenne pepper (optional, spiciness)
ENCHILADA SAUCE
▢2 tbsp olive oil
▢3 tbsp flour , plain/all purpose
▢2 cups (500ml) chicken stock / broth , low sodium
▢1 1/2 cups (375 ml) tomato passata OR US 1 can (8 oz) canned tomato sauce (eg Hunts) (Note 2)
▢1/4 tsp each salt and pepper
BEEF
▢1 tbsp olive oil
▢2 garlic cloves , minced
▢1 onion , finely chopped (~1 cup)
▢1 lb / 500g ground beef (mince)
▢400g / 14oz refried beans (1 can, I use Old El Paso)
▢400g / 14oz black beans, drained (1 can, Note 3)
ENCHILADAS
▢8 tortillas (or burrito wraps)
▢1.5 cups (150g) grated melting cheese, or more (I like Monterey Jack, tasty or cheddar cheese)
▢Cilantro/coriander leaves , roughly chopped (optional garnish)
Instructions
Mix together Spice Mix ingredients. Set aside.
ENCHILADA SAUCE
Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and mix to combine into a paste. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add 1/2 cup chicken broth, whisk straight away then it will turn into a thick smooth paste quite quickly.
Add remaining chicken broth, passata, salt, pepper and 2 tablespoons of SPICE MIX. Whisk
Increase heat slightly to medium high. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes, whisking regularly, until the sauce thickens to the consistency of thick syrup (see video). Remove from stove.
FILLING
Preheat oven to 180C/350F.
Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Add garlic and onion, cook for 2 minutes.
Add beef and cook for 2 minutes, breaking it up as you go. Add remaining Spice Mix. Cook for a further 2 minutes or until completely brown.
Add refried beans, black beans, about 1/4 cup of Enchilada Sauce + salt & pepper. Mix (Note 4) and cook for 2 minutes then remove from stove (see video).
ENCHILADAS
Smear a bit of Sauce on the bottom of a baking dish (stops sliding).
Place filling on the lower third of a tortilla. Roll up then place in the baking dish, seam side down. Repeat with remaining Filling & Tortillas.
Pour Sauce over the Enchiladas, top with cheese, bake for 10 minutes covered (Note 5) then 10 minutes uncovered. Serve hot!
Recipe Notes:
1. You can just use all onion or garlic powder, if you only have one of them. Fresh garlic is not the same, however, as a last resort substitution, you can use 3 garlic cloves, minced, instead of onion & garlic powder. Saute in the heated oil before proceeding with the recipe.
2. Tomato passata is pureed plain tomatoes that is not seasoned. Unlike crushed tomatoes, it is thick and smooth, like a thick tomato soup. In Australia it can be purchased in a bottle in the pasta aisle of major supermarkets (Coles, Woolworths). You can make your own simply by using a blender to puree canned tomatoes.
America: If you can’t find passata in the US (it is available at Walmart, Costco), a great substitute is US canned tomato sauce eg Hunts (yes, I’m such a food nerd I brought back cans to use for this recipe and it’s a near perfect substitute).
3. Black beans are commonly used in Mexican & Tex Mex cooking. It’s becoming more widely available in Australia. It can be purchased in the Mexican or canned beans aisle in most major supermarkets, as well as Harris Farms and Thomas Dux. You can substitute with red kidney beans or another type of beans if you prefer.
4. The refried beans should loosen as it heats and stir through easily. If not, add a splash of water.
5. To bake covered, I just pop a baking tray on top on the baking dish. Otherwise, cover with foil.
6. To make ahead, roll up enchiladas and place in casserole dish (can smear with sauce underneath). Keep sauce separate and top just before baking.
https://www.recipetineats.com/beef-enchiladas/
Mmmmmm that sounds good and with in my skill range.   So much useful info there!   How about a Spanish rice recipe for a side?

Spanish Rice is a great side for enchiladas.
Ingredients 
▢2 cups long grain rice
▢1/8 cup vegetable oil
▢8 oz tomato sauce
▢6 stems cilantro (optional)
▢1 tsp salt
▢1 tsp minced garlic
▢4 cups water (or 4 cups chicken lower sodium chicken broth - and no bouillon)
▢1 cube chicken flavored bouillon
▢dash cumin
▢dash garlic pepper
Instructions 
Heat oil in large frying pan on medium heat.
Add rice and cook until golden brown.
Add 1 chicken flavored bouillon cube to 4 cups water and microwave for 3 minutes.
When rice is brown, add water, tomato sauce, salt, garlic, cumin and garlic pepper to pan.
Stir and cover pan. Let simmer for 30-40 minutes or until all is cooked and there is no liquid left. Fluff before serving and ENJOY.
https://lilluna.com/food-tutorial-spanish-rice/
any other suggestions?

OK, that's great to know. Here's a recipe for a pasta with tomato-based sauce.

Double tomato sauce pasta
6 cherry tomatoes
4 fresh basil leaves
Olive oil
Salt

150g canned tomatoes
2 cloves garlic
1 teaspoon tomato paste

70g pasta shape of your choice

Instructions
Chop cherry tomatoes into halves and place into a bowl. Tear up basil leaves and add them into the bowl with plenty of olive oil and salt. Mix the tomatoes and basil well, and put it aside.

Mince garlic. Heat up a saucepan with olive oil and add the minced garlic. Add canned tomatoes and tomato paste once garlic is golden brown. Remove from heat after 10 min. 

Boil pasta until al dente.

To serve, layer a spoonful of pasta followed by the cooked sauce and the cherry tomatoes, until your plate is full. Repeat and enjoy!

I

I am also doing well and ready to cook breakfast

No, no restrictions and I am only cooking for myself. I just want something simple
How much time do you have to cook? And what ingredients do you have on hand?
I like to make a quick breakfast - no more than 20 minutes. I have some eggs, bread, some granola, cereal, milk. The usual

Thank you for all your help!

I need some ideas to cook diner tonight for myself and my partner, if you could help?

I'd be happy to help. Before we start are there any food allergies or do you or your partner follow any specific dietary requirements? such as being vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, or having any other dietary preferences
No, none of us have any food allergies, I tend to follow a low carbohydrate diet though

Thank you for the information, just a little further information before we start with any recipes. How would you rate your ability at cooking and what is your time availability for cooking? This is just to provide more personalized recipe recommendations.

No problem, I'm no master chef but more than capable cutting and chopping, and mixing a few ingredients to make a sauce. Luckily I'm off this afternoon so have around 6 hours just in case i need to go and get some ingredients

That's great, we could certainly create a great dish in 
 6 hours. Do you have a preference for any types of cuisine? and what do you regularly cook during the week?

Through the week, I would usually just have some meat such as chicken or fish with some vegetables. Because of our work schedules, we don't normally eat together so won't to cook something a little more special. We both like Indian or Thai cuisine

That is such a good idea to make a special meal while you have the opportunity, I hope my advice can make the night special for you both. As both the Indian and Thai cuisine can contain many spices and heat, do you have any preferences on the level of heat?

dialogue.message: Hi, I could do with some ideas on what to cook for breakfast, if you could help?

No problem, I am happy to help. First of all, I could do with some information to help guide any recommendations. What is your time availability for cooking? Are you cooking for yourself or with others? and are their any health goals or dietary restrictions that I need to be aware of?

It is just me for today, my partner has already left for work.  I have around 2 hours before I have to leave so want something that is simple to make. No allergies but don't want to eat gluten, and needs to be low in calories but high in protein

Thank you for the information, that is a great help. I've found a recipe for an apple and cinnamon breakfast bowl https://theherbeevore.com/apple-cinnamon-high-protein-breakfast-bowl-gluten-free/. The recipe is gluten free, low in calories and high in protein, and does not require any cooking so is very simple to make. Does this sound like a good recipe for you or would you like me to find something else?
I like the idea of the breakfast bowls, as I could take them to work with me. I'm not a fan of apple but could you recommend something something similar but with berries?

No problem, I've found a recipe for a blueberry parfait that you may like https://www.sarahbakesgfree.com/2016/04/gluten-free-vegan-blueberry-breakfast-parfaits.html . These are also gluten free, low in calories and high in protein. However, these do require a cooking time of 45mins in total but does fall within your time restrictions.
Thank you, the blueberry parfait sound really nice, I think I will give them ago for breakfast
Interesting choice, what made you choose the blueberry parfait?
I really liked the idea of making my own granola, so can make a big batch of it for future use
I'm glad I could be of assistance and that you liked my recommendations. Good luck making the granola and the rest of the parfait
Thank you for the great recommendations

time_availability: 2 hours before I have to leave

dialogue.message: Hi, I'm looking for some ideas for lunch as I have a few hours spare before I go out for the evening

No problem, I am happy to help you. I will need some information to help with my recommendations. Can you tell me how much time you have available to prepare lunch? Do you have any preferences on cuisine or health goals for lunch? and what ingredients do you have available?

I have around 90 minutes that I could spare to make lunch. No specific preferences but would like something light such as fish as I'm going out for a meal tonight. I have plenty in such as salmon, basa or chicken plus plenty of vegetables and herbs and spices
Would your partner be joining you for lunch or anybody else? and if so, would they have any preferences for lunch? Do you have any specific ingredient preferences for today's lunch?
My partner will be joining me today, she much prefers fish over chicken so I'm thinking salmon or possibly tuna. As it is nice and warm today, I'm thinking something quite zesty or lemon flavoured

That sounds like a good choice with the warm weather today. I have found a highly recommended recipe for pan fried salmon with a lemon garlic butter sauce, https://cafedelites.com/crispy-seared-lemon-garlic-herb-salmon/ this is low in calories with a buttery and zesty lemon flavour. I have also found a similar recipe for tuna https://www.lecremedelacrumb.com/sheet-pan-lemon-herb-tuna-steaks-and-potatoes/. Would you like any of these recipes for lunch?
Thank you, I'm liking the sound of the salmon and lemon garlic butter sauce. Only takes a few ingredients and seems very easy to make. Could you recommend a salad to go with it?
Certainly, are there any dietary restrictions for the salad? and would you prefer a light citrusy salad similar to the fish or a more robust and hearty one?
no restrictions, I'm thinking more of a light citrus salad that would compliment the fish more
Thank for the information, I've found a recipe for a citrus and avocado salad that should compliment the fish very well https://www.gimmesomeoven.com/sunshine-citrus-avocado-salad
Thank you, that sound like a good combination

dish_like: salmon and lemon garlic butter sauce

Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello!  I need some inspiration on what to cook for dinner.
OK, what kind of foods do you like?  And are there any you can't eat, or choose not to eat?
Nothing too spicy.  And I can't eat gluten or most fruits, and have to be careful with herbs.
Do you need something quick and easy, or are you looking for an elaborate meal?
Something I can make inside an hour, and not cheffy - good plain cooking is what I want.
What do you usually make for dinner? Can you give me some examples?
bolognese - chilli - chicken in paprika - jacket spuds.  That kind of thing.

How about this one? https://www.easypeasyfoodie.com/chicken-chilli-con-carne/ The coriander is just added at the end, so you could skip that if coriander is a no-no.  Just use the same amount of chilli you would in your usual recipe and it shouldn't be too hot.
That's not bad.  I lik e that it has alternative versions - I do prefer chicken breast to thighs.  Any other ideas?
Would you like something more adventurous?
A little bit different to what I usually cook.
I'm pleased you turned to me for ideas.  How about this one? https://easychickenrecipes.com/broccoli-cheese-stuffed-chicken-breast/ There are lots of variations at the end too.
Now that does look tasty.  There are several there I could eat.  Thanks!

dialogue.message: Hiya!  do you have any ideas how I can make breakfast less boring?
What do you usually have? And are we talking about grabbing something before you head out to work, or a leisurely weekend breakfast?
Something different from plain porridge.  Weekend breakfasts - work days I'm too sleepy to bother.
What about a flapjack?  Several versions here https://flawlessfood.co.uk/easy-flapjack-recipe/
Yes, I could make that.  A bit rich for breakfast though - something a bit plainer?
Maybe this one? https://minimalistbaker.com/peanut-butter-overnight-oats/ More interesting than plain porridge but without the heavy buttery and sweet nature of flapjack.
Yes, that might work.  I'll save the flapjack for supper!
Are there any particular toppings you like?
It's a question of what I can eat.  Most toppings are fruit-based.
I'm glad I found you something tasty to make your porridge a bit less boring.  Thanks for asking me for help.
Thank you for your assistance!
Hi, can you give me some ideas for lunch?
Is this just for you or are you hosting?  What ingredients do you have in?
Just me.  I've got the usual stuff in, home-made gluten-free bread, potatoes, eggs, cheese - I just need a different way of putting them together.
Do you want quick sandwich ideas or a cooked lunch?
Not a sandwich - I want something hot.
What about frittata, like this one https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/full-english-frittata ?  Doesn't take long to make, is good plain tasty food.
I like the idea but have no mushrooms.
this one's similar but with cheese, not mushrooms https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/68898/potato-and-cheese-frittata/
Yes, I could do that.  Actually,  might combine the two - bacon and cheese is always a good combination.
Bacon and cheese together?  Why those two?  And is there anything else you'd add in?
Salty-crispy plus salty-creamy.  Extra-flavoured but it's the texture combination that makes it so good.  A sliced tomato on top would add a touch of sweetness.
I like it!  Always important to think about textures as well as the taste.  Thanks for asking me for ideas, and I hope you enjoy your lunch.  Bye!
Thanks,

My day is great. I  would like to know a dish for lunch what can you find for me?

Also are you cooking this just for yourself or for family members and do you have any dietary restrictions or allergies? If this is a special occasion please also let me know. Thank you!

I have a little less than an hour to cook. I'm looking for a seafood dish that can feed my whole family. I usually cook all types of dishes but I'm feeling seafood for lunch today. As far as dietary restrictions or allergies I have none. This is just going to be a lunch with my family so no special occasion.

So I believe that this dish would be perfect for you and your family and would be able to feed them all and won't take long to make. The dish itself is called ceviche it has shrimp and other vegetables that would be a healthy option. I noticed on your preferences that you like Mexican food and this is a Mexican dish as well. I would appreciate it if you could tell me if this is a good fit for you and your family. Here is the link to the shrimp ceviche.
https://downshiftology.com/recipes/ceviche/

That is an amazing dish to make for my family and fits right where I want it under the 1 hour mark. I also like that it's very  healthy in terms of having a lot of vegetables so my kids can eat something that will benefit them.

What exactly makes this dish so appealing to you if you don't mind me asking? Is it the flavors the ingredients or anything else? Also is there anything in the dish itself you are excited to try out or are there any concerns you have about the dish?

I think just the ingredients themselves. Like I said previously, the vegetables let me know it's a healthy dish and I can feed it to my kids not feeling guilty. I think what I'm most excited to try out on it is the shrimp because it sounds like it would taste really good. The only concern to me would be the time. It's really close to the 1 hour mark but I think I should be fine.

Thank you for your feedback and I can assure you that it will all work out, you're a great cook and you can have it done nice and quickly ready for your family. Thank you for trusting me to get your recipe for your family, have a great day!
Thank you for the reassurance and you as well.

Bye!

ingredient_availability: Has a majority of the ingredients needed for a suggested recipe

dialogue.message: Hello! I have an important day coming up and would like advice on what to cook for breakfast, I'd like to make it special considering the occasion.
Hello, I'd be glad to help! What's the occasion if you don't mind me asking?
My mother-in-law is visiting all the way from the United Kingdom, which is why I want the breakfast to be special and memorable.
Since she's visiting from the United Kingdom, perhaps you would want to try your hand at cooking a typical British dish. Do you have a lot of time to cook the recipe, or are you in a hurry?
I like the idea of that, I'll give British cuisine a chance. I'm not in a hurry so I don't mind how long it takes.
I recommend this recipe for you, it'll be sure to impress your mother-in-law cooking such a traditional dish. https://englishbreakfastsociety.com/english-breakfast-recipe.html
I'm having trouble viewing the recipe due to the formatting of the website. Could you please send me a different link?
Of course! Try this one and let Of course! Here's a different one. https://www.ramonascuisine.com/english-breakfast-in-a-pot-in-a-flash/
Great. Thank you so much for all your help, goodbye!
Hello! I'm once again looking for a recipe idea.
Hi, I'd be glad to help! What kind of recipe are you looking for? Breakfast, lunch, or dinner?
I'm looking for something to eat for lunch today.
What type of cuisine are you looking for? Something Southern or Italian like before? Also how much time are you able to spend on the recipe?
I'm really in the mood for Italian today. I have a few hours so I'm not in need of a fast recipe.
https://www.loveandlemons.com/homemade-pizza/ This recipe allows you to create a beautiful, yet simple pizza that tastes great.
This looks perfect! Thank you once again!
Is that all you need? Or will another recipe suggestion align further with your interests?
No thanks, the recipe you sent is perfectly fine. I've never made homemade pizza before but I'm eager to give it a shot.
Good luck! I hope you enjoy it! Take care.
Goodbye.

time_availability: not in need of a fast recipe

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, can you help me come up with some ideas for what to cook for dinner? I need all options to be vegetarian
No problem, I can help you come up with some vegetarian meal ideas! Do you have any other foods that you avoid, or any foods that you would particularly like to be included in suggestions?
I quite like vegan food. I also like Indian and East Asian dishes. But my key requirements are just that the dinner ideas should be vegetarian, fairly filling and not be too difficult

Sure, I'll keep those in mind! Do you have a lot of time to cook dinner, or would you prefer meal ideas that are quick to cook? I see that you don't want overly difficult suggestions - would you say you are a beginner, intermediate, or expert cook?

I'm an intermediate cook, I'm just quite a lazy one! So yes I would quite like quicker meal ideas, with low or medium difficulty, but I am able to cook intermediate recipes if I really like the look of them
That makes a lot of sense! Alright, I think I'm getting a better idea of your food preferences now. How do you feel about spicy or strong flavoured foods, for example spicy curries?
I have a low spice tolerance but I still like curries, especially creamier or milder curries. Do you have any suggestions for me?

I certainly think that Indian foods offer a lot of great, filling, vegetarian options that are not too spicy for you! Before I give you any recommendations, can you tell me what you usually cook week to week? Are there any specific ingredients or flavours that you really enjoy, or do you have any goals that you like to achieve through diet, like health goals? Any additional information will be great for helping me tailor your recommendations!

I quite like lower carb dishes because I think they are a bit healthier. I do like rice a lot though, as well as noodles. I often make myself ramen dishes, creamy sweet potato curries, egg based dishes etc

Alright! For a low carb, East Asian, filling and healthy vegetarian option, how about something like this vegetable stir fry with keto noodles. Of course, you could adapt this dish to include regular noodles and still have a healthy, filling dish! https://ketodietapp.com/Blog/lchf/keto-asian-vegetable-and-noodle-stir-fry

Or how about this sweet potato and chickpea curry, which will be filling and full of flavour? You could even serve it with brown rice instead of white rice for more complex carbs! https://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/sweet_potato_and_68565
I like the look of the sweet potato and chickpea curry. I also like that the stir fry has peanut butter in it, which I like a lot in dishes. I think it's too complex though

This vegan peanut curry has both peanuts and sweet potatoes, for the best of both worlds! It's flavourful rather than spicy and should be quite filling! https://www.lazycatkitchen.com/vegan-peanut-curry-sweet-potato/ 

How does that sound?
It sounds really tasty! That's quite a lot of ingredients to buy to make the dish though, some of which my nearest supermarket may not have like the ginger and turmeric

Of course! I will try to suggest another dish with more accessible ingredients. This quick and easy peanut and sweet potato curry has fewer ingredients, as well as being vegan and filling. https://glutenfreecuppatea.co.uk/2020/03/20/peanut-butter-curry-recipe-vegan/

This recipe doesn't use ginger and turmeric, which may make it easier to cook. How does it sound?
That sounds pretty good actually. It's quick and I like the ingredients. I can easily get most of them except maybe the chilli puree, but I reckon I can substitute something for that

Great! Perhaps one of these would make a good chilli puree substitute, so that you can still cook this dish if you'd like to: https://foodsguy.com/chili-paste-substitutes/

What else do you like about this recipe? Maybe I can find more recipes that are relevant for you!

I think I'll just use fresh chillis or chilli flakes in this recipe. I don't really have any interest in gluten free dishes, however, so that part of the recipe isn't relevant to me. I like everything else though

I'm so glad to hear that this is a dish you'd be interested in making! I agree that this recipe will be easy to adapt to your own tastes, as it doesn't have to many ingredients. Both fresh or dried chillis will likely make a great substitute for chilli puree, and the gluten free soy sauce can easily be substituted for regular soy sauce. I hope I've been a help in resolving your dinner questions. Let me know if there is anything further you'd like me to help with!
No, I'm happy with this recipe. Thanks!

dish_like: quick and easy peanut and sweet potato curry

dialogue.message: Hi, can you help me with some breakfast ideas? I'm kind of tired of my usual ideas
I'd be happy to! You say that you're tired of your usual dishes - what kind of foods do you normally eat for breakfast? Do you have any preferences or restrictions for breakfast foods in general?

I usually have porridge, which is cheap and filling and I like that about it. But I'd like to try more savoury dishes for breakfast. I don't want to eat traditional British or American breakfast foods

No problem. To start, do you have a lot of free time to cook breakfast, or not a lot of free time? Is there anything you cook a lot for breakfast, other than porridge? And will you be cooking for just yourself, or for other people as well?

I'm cooking just for myself. I probably have about twenty minutes to make breakfast, at the most. I usually have porridge, cereal, or something toasted like crumpets etc. I'm just really bored of breakfasts with lots of carbs

Let's see if I can find you a savoury breakfast dish that will work well for you! How would you feel about savoury oatmeal? Although it may be too similar to porridge for your taste, the flavours and textures may be different enough to feel fresh. How about this savoury oatmeal with eggs? https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/267654/savory-oatmeal-with-cheddar-collards-eggs/

It's still filling and easy, with a more savoury feel overall.
Maybe. I feel a bit weird about savoury oatmeal. And I'd prefer dishes that have less dairy and eggs, though I wouldn't rule them out entirely

Here's an alternative that I've found: https://www.theworktop.com/breakfast-brunch-recipes/vegetable-congee/

This dish is still savoury, but uses rice instead of oats which you may feel more comfortable with! It's a vegan recipe, although of course you could add an egg if you would wish! What do you think?
I quite like the look of that, especially with some tofu on top. It takes a long time to cook though! I'd have to make it the night before

Making breakfast the night before could be a great way to save time in the morning, but I can understand that you might want a fresh breakfast instead! Here is an alternative along the same lines. It is a vegan congee that is quick, one pot, savoury and filling, so you should be able to still make this within time constraints! https://joyfuldumplings.com/quick-easy-vegan-congee/

What do you think?

I might try both congee recipes to be honest. I like this congee recipe, I find it reassuring that it's meant to be really quick to cook. I also like that it's hot and savoury, and it's kind of cool to try a non-British breakfast dish
Trying new dishes is certainly fun! What else is appealing to you about congee and non-British breakfast foods? Perhaps I can find more dishes that you would like!

I just like that other countries do breakfast very differently, and they often have savoury foods like rice, fish etc. I am vegetarian though. Also, I find it easier to try traditional dishes than newly created dishes, because I trust that they're good because they've been popular for a good time

That makes a lot of sense! Dishes that have been around for longer are certainly tried and tested. I hope that you enjoy trying out these congee recipes! Thank you for sharing your opinions with me. Let me know if there's anything else I can help you with :)
Not at the moment. Thanks
Hi again. I liked the congee and the curry you suggested. Can you help me with lunch ideas?

Happy to hear that you enjoyed my suggestions! Let's think about lunch. Tell me, how much time do you have available for cooking lunch? What do you normally cook, or enjoy eating for lunch? Any favourite, or hated flavours? Do you have any dietary restrictions or health goals for lunch?

Vegetarian is must, vegan is preferable but not necessary. I wouldn't want to spend more than 45 minutes cooking lunch, and honestly the less time spent cooking the better. For lunch, I like quite big, filling meals to get me through the rest of the day. Doesn't have to be a hot meal though.

No problem! If you don't mind a cold lunch, but still want something filling, how about this vegan banh mi sandwich recipe? https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/boxing-day-banh-mi

This recipe has a few asian elements like the dressing and the use of fresh, colourful vegetables. The houmous and tempeh make for a filling, hearty lunch that is healthy and has interesting textures! Although the recipe suggests the use of hot sauce to serve, this is optional and can easily be left out. The carbs in this dish are also balanced out with the inclusions of fresh vegetables and protein. What do you think?

That does look interesting and tasty. What I like best about it is the quick pickled fresh vegetables and the asian dressing, rather than the houmous and tempeh. But I do like the asian-inspired, cold dish idea

It sounds like you would enjoy fresh vegetables in your lunch dish, and that you quite enjoy interesting flavours such as pickles and dressings, is that correct? Is there anything else you liked about the vegan banh mi?

That's correct, though I don't like creamy dressings. I like bright, flavourful dressings. I guess I like that this is a finger food that I could eat at my desk after making, or take my time over, but it's still very filling

Thank you for your feedback! It sounds like this could be an interesting dish for you to try in that case, as it doesn't have creamy dressing and it's a food you can take your time over. Would you like any more lunch ideas?

I like the banh mi recipe but I'm not fully sold on it because of the houmous and tempeh. So unless you have similar recipes that do not have houmous and tempeh, I will probably try this recipe and adapt it to my needs

time_availability: The less time spent cooking the better

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, what do you suggest I have for dinner tonight.  I need a meal for 2 adults and a child
Great!  You've come to the right place.  So I see you need a family meal suitable for adults and a child.  Do you have an allergies or dietary requirements I need to know about?
No, we dont have any allergies and we eat most foods
ok, so you have no allergies and eat most foods.  What type of cuisine do you like?
we like italian,, indian, mexican, thai and usual British meals
How much time do you have to prepare your meal?  Also, how would you rate your cooking skills?
I have about 30 minutes to prepare the meal and I'm a fairly good cook
what type of meal did you have last night? Are there any spices or flavours you dont like?
we had a cottage pie last night with some veg.  We hate dill!

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/collection/fajitas-recipes
here are some fajita recipes which should suit your need for a family meal that can be made in 30 minutes and does not contain dill
thanks, I'll take a loo

there are also plenty of easy family recipes here that meet your needs.  Do any of these sounds suitable? https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/easy-thai-prawn-curry

this curry would work for you as it does not contain dill and can be prepared in 20 minutes
Hi, yes that looks good
Perfect! I'm glad we've found a recipe that you like
thanks for your help
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, I am looking for some recommendations for dinner tonight. I am vegetarian and like pasta dishes.
Great, I've noted that you're vegetarian and like pasta. Do you have any other dietary requirements or preferences?
I like cheese and vegetable based dishes. I don't have any allergies or intolerances.
What is your level of cooking skills, beginner, intermediate or advanced? How much time do you have available to cook?
I'm a beginner so easy recipes only please. I have about 30 minutes.
Is the meal for a particular special occasion? Are there any ingredients you would like me to include?
No, it's just a weekday tea but I want to expand my range of recipes. I would like something which includes cheese and mediterranean vegetables

What do you think of this recipe? It's a mediterranean vegetable pasta dish which takes 35 minutes to cook, and you can add parmesan to include the cheese you asked for

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/silvanas-mediterranean-basil-pasta)
Hmm, I'm not a fan of parmesan. Can you find a recipe with mozzarella please?

I've found a recipe for Mediterranean vegetable and mozzarella pasta which is really quick and easy and takes just 15 minutes. What do you think?

https://therealfoodgeek.com/mediterranean-vegetable-pasta/
I don't think this has mozarella in, and I'm looking to develop my cooking skills so I'd prefer a 30 minute recipe

How about this one? It's a pasta bake with mediterranean vegetables and mozzarella, and includes a few different simple cooking techniques to help develop your skills

https://www.kitchensanctuary.com/vegetable-pasta-bake/
Thank you. I like this one. It has mozarella, mediterranean vegetables and past, and I like that it's a bake but still only takes 30 minutes.
What is it that most appeals to you about this recipe?
I like the ingredients and that it's a bake, and I like that it will help me develop my cooking techniques
That's great. I'm glad to have helped you find a new recipe. I hope you enjoy cooking it and of course eating the results.
Thank you
Hi, I wondered if you had any suggestions for breakfast recipes?
Yes of course. What are your breakfast preferences? Would you like something hot or cold? How much time do you have available in the morning?
I don't have much time available in the morning. Usually I eat cereal but I'm getting bored of it. I'd probably say a cold breakfast cos I don't have much time.

How about this? It takes less than 15 minutes and is a pear and blueberry breakfast bowl. 

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/pear-blueberry-breakfast-bowl
Hmm, I think 15 minutes is quite a long time in a morning and I'm not a big fan of pears. Can you find me something nutty?

I wonder if this might work for you then? It's a pistachio and spiced apple bircher muesli. It only takes 10 minutes to prepare but needs to soak overnight so saves time in the morning, and it includes the nuts you asked for:

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/pistachio-nut-spiced-apple-bircher-muesli
Ooh I like that idea. Preparing it the night before will definitely save me time.
Great, is there a particular reason you need to save time, and what is it about a nutty breakfast that you like
Yes, I'm always in a rush in the mornings so need a quick breakfast that tastes good. I really like pistachio nuts and they're filling too.
Thank you, that helps me with future recommendations. I hope you enjoy your breakfast.
Thanks for your help

time_availability: Not much time available in the morning
Prefers breakfast that can be prepared the night before
Always in a rush in the mornings
dish_like: Prefers a cold breakfast due to time constraints
Likes pistachio nuts and prefers a filling breakfast

dialogue.message: Hi, have you any suggestions for a weekend lunch?
How much time do you have available on weekends for preparing lunch? Do you have any preferences for cuisine or ingredients you'd like to include?
I don't mind so much about time as I'm less rushed but I still don't want to spend all day cooking. I'd like something healthy as I'm trying to improve my diet at present.

I wonder what you think of this. It's a hummus bowl. It's quick and easy, really healthy as it's full of vegetables and you can customize it to your personal taste?

https://www.acouplecooks.com/hummus-bowl/
Hmm. I like the veggies but I hate hummus so this one's not for me.

Okay so no hummus!! How about an ultimate avocado sandwich. It's healthy and veg based.

https://www.acouplecooks.com/avocado-sandwich/
I often have a sandwich as a workday lunch so I'd prefer something different at the weekend

How about this idea then. It's healthy, full of veg and has cheese which I know you enjoy

https://hurrythefoodup.com/avocado-citrus-salad-with-feta/
I like this recipe
What is it that appeals to you most about it?
It's got some ingredients I really enjoy. I love the taste of avocado, citrus fruits, feta and spinach so to have them all in one lunch is great
Thank you, that's really useful. Enjoy making and eating your delicious lunch.
Thank you

occasion_or_theme: prefer something different at the weekend

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
What should I cook for dinner?
Hi there! Thank you for your request for a dinner recipe, before I can make any suggestions, please tell me if you have any food allergies or dietary requirements.
I do not have any food allergies or dietary requirements to worry about.
Thank you for letting me know. What is your skill level in cooking, and how much time do you have for cooking dinner?
I am a beginner level cook, and I have 45 minutes to prepare dinner.
Thanks for letting me know you are a beginner cook with 45 minutes to cook dinner. Next I'd like to know if you have any food preferences or cooking habits that you would like me to consider?
I was thinking of spaghetti for dinner, and I like to try and keep it simple.

You can cook the spaghetti noodles and toss them with a flavorful tomato sauce. Let me know if you want to try this recipe or not.' When making recommendations, use the collected user's preferences, such as their preference for spaghetti and keeping it simple. The assistant should search the web and provide the URL of the recipe when making a recommendation. Delete this advice and compose your utterance in this text box.)

https://www.averiecooks.com/easy-15-minute-spaghetti/

I recommend trying a simple spaghetti recipe such as the one in the link I've provided above. It's a classic dish  which is easy to prepare for a beginner such as yourself, and will only take 15 minutes. The link I've provided will help you to cook the noodles and make a nice pasta sauce. Please let me know if you want to try this recipe or not.
I have reviewed your recommendation , and I think it is exactly what I wanted.  It is simple to make, and won't take too long. So this is perfect, thanks!
I'm so pleased you liked my recommendation! Before we continue, are there any specific ingredients you wish to include or avoid in the recipe?
No, nothing like that.
Thank you very much for requesting my help with choosing your dinner, I hope everything goes well making spaghetti. If there's nothing else, this conversation will end.
ok goodbye.
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Good Evening, please could you help me find something easy I can cook for dinner?
Do you have any food allergies or dietary requirements?
No, I don't have any allergies or dietary requirements, though I'd like it to be semi healthy!
What is your skill level in cooking and time availability for cooking?
I am not the best cook so something rather basic and easy to cook would be great, I only have one hour maximum I could dedicate to cooking
what types of dishes do you frequently cook each week? What are your current cuisine preferences?
I cook Spaghetti Bolognese, Oven Pizza and Chicken Korma Curry fairly often. I prefer Italian dishes with either Pizza or Pasta!

I have found a good one for you, Ultimate Spaghetti Carbonana, takes 15-20 mins with easy cooking skill rating and as you said you liked Italian food. Here is the link https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/ultimate-spaghetti-carbonara-recipe

Let me know what you think
Thank you, that sounds delicious, I think I may well go ahead with that one unless you have any other suggestions?
What specifically interests you about the Ultimate Spaghetti Carbonara recipe? Are there any specific ingredients or flavors you are looking for, or any reasons why you are considering this recipe?
I have tried Spaghetti Carbonara before and like it, with the creamy sauce and bacon it appeals. The fact it is ultimate makes it more special
Thank you for confirming that the Ultimate Spaghetti Carbonara recipe is a great choice for you to try. I hope you enjoy the meal and have a good evening.
Thank you for your help
Good morning, please could you give me some inspiration about what to cook for breakfast?

what is your time availability for cooking? What types of dishes do you frequently cook each week? Any cuisine preferences, specific flavours or ingredients you enjoy or dislike? Any seasonal ingredients you prefer? Who are you cooking for? Any dietary restrictions or health goals? Is there a special occasion or theme for which you need a recipe?

I have 20mins max as I need to go to work after. Usually I have Cereal with milk and a yoghurt and a Coffee. I prefer cold options and like something with fibre and sweet and slightly sugary. I am just cooking for myself and the main goal is to give myself enough energy to get going for the day.
Are there any specific flavors or ingredients you enjoy in your breakfast? Are there any seasonal ingredients you prefer for your morning meal?
I like cereal and oats, I also like dairy such as milk and yoghurts. There are no seasonal ingredients I prefer.

Ok, I found one you'll like, it's high in Fibre and only takes 5-15mins to prepare and includes Muesli. Here is the link
https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/high-fibre-muesli

Let me know what you think
Oooh thank you, that looks good and similar to what I have had in the past!
What specifically interests you about the recommended recipe? Is there is anything in particular that appeals to you?
I like that it is high in Fibre and familiar to me as I've had Muesli before. I also like the quick cooking time!
Thank you for you positive feedback, and I wish you a great day!
Thank you for your help!

health_goals: enough energy to get going for the day

dialogue.message: Good Morning, I'm looking for something delicious to cook for lunch, what do you suggest?

What is your time availability for cooking? What types of dishes do you frequently cook each week? Any current cuisine preferences, specific flavors or ingredients you enjoy or dislike? Are you cooking for yourself or others? Any health goals or dietary restrictions, and specific ingredients you currently have on hand?

I have 45mins to cook. Usually I just have a sandwich as a quick lunch but sometimes I cook a pasta or rice dish. I really like the idea of having a pizza for lunch. My favourite ingredients are Pepperoni, Chicken and lots of Cheese! It would be just for me and with no health or dietary goals in mind as my lunches need to feel like a treat!
Ok so 1hr and you like Pizza with meaty toppings such as Chicken and Pepperoni? Do you have any ingredients on hand?
45mins, not 1hr! But yes I love meaty pizzas, I already have pizza base in the fridge and diced chicken and pepperoni slices as well as plenty of cheese!

Ok great, I've found you a meat lovers pizza which includes chicken and pepperoni and other meats too. Here is the link 
https://www.thespruceeats.com/meat-lovers-pizza-4691949

It takes 24mins to prepare in total so well within the 45mins specified. Let me know what you think!
That is perfect, it looks amazing thank you, I would like to go ahead with that meat lovers pizza!
What specifically appeals to you about the meat lovers pizza? Any particular combination of meat toppings and cheese?
Yes I love the combination of meats, particularly Chicken and Pepperoni and the fact it has plenty of cheese makes it sound like a dream lunch!
Thank you for your feedback on the meat lovers pizza recommendation and I'd like to wish a bon apetit and feel free to come back to me whenever you need more inspiration!
Thank you so much for your help, you've been great!
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
I'm thinking of making something for dinner tonight. Could you suggest something?
Definitely! I'd love to help. Do you have any allergies or preferences to consider. Maybe a diet need?
No, I don't have any allergies, and I'm pretty open to different types of food. Any particularly simple recipes?
Okay David. Could I gauge your skill level? How would you rate your talents out of 1-5 and how much time do you have?
I'd say I'm somewhere between a beginner and intermediate. Basic cooking techniques but nothing too fancy. 30 min sounds fine
What's your usual food on a chill day? And are there any particular cuisines that you're a fan of or maybe something new you've been wanting to try?
I usually stick to pretty simple stuff during the week, like pasta dishes or stirfries. I'm a big fan of Italian and Asian

Oh David, I've got just the thing for you! It's Italian, super easy to make, and you'll have it on the table in no time: Check the Bow - Tie Pasta listed as number 2: https://www.tasteofhome.com/collection/30-pasta-dinners-ready-in-30-minutes/#20
That sounds really interesting, and I do like the idea of a quick pasta dish. However, I'm not the biggest fan of Gorgonzola cheese. Do you have another recipe in mind
I found a great recipe that might be more up your alley. It's a chicken stirfry: https://www.wholesomeyum.com/chicken-stir-fry/
This Chicken Stir Fry recipe sounds great! I'll give it a try tonight and let you know how it turns out
Before you get started, are there any specific veggies or flavors you're really into or maybe some you'd rather leave out?

I'm pretty happy with the veggies listed in the recipe, but I'm thinking of adding some snap peas for a bit of crunch. Also, I love a bit of heat, so I might throw in some red pepper flakes or a dash of sriracha
Snap peas and a kick of heat sound like fantastic additions, David. Feel free to reach out anytime if you need more ideas or run into a culinary question!!!
Thanks a lot for all your help! I'm pretty excited to see how this turns out
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
I would like to cook something family friendly, with nothing spicy, without peppers and possibly with cheese.
Hi there, i would be glad to help! Let's get started. Are you interested in cooking for breakfast, lunch or dinner?
Hi, i'm looking to cook for dinner
Great, Do you have any food allergies, or dietary requirements, such as vegetarian, vegan or gluten-free?
No, no allergies but i would like to request nothing spicy or peppers.
How about your skill level in cooking, are you a beginner or more experienced in cooking? Also what is your availability in preparing meals?
I'm not a complete beginner but not very experienced, and i have a good amount of time to prepare.
What types of dishes do you usually like to cook, do you have a specific cuisine in mind? Do you have any specific flavors or ingredients you enjoy? Do you have any health goals or restrictions?
I enjoy most cuisines, no specific flavors and no health goals or restrictions.

I would like to recommend this creamy macaroni and cheese, it's family-friendly, non-spicy, and includes cheese as to your preferences. What do you think? https://www.thechunkychef.com/family-favorite-baked-mac-and-cheese/
Sounds and looks great!

Great, I'm glad you like the recommendation! Do you have any specific preferences for the macaroni and cheese recipe, such as adding any additional ingredients or serving it with a particular side dish?
No, it sounds and looks great as it is, mac and cheese usually goes down a treat, i would probably serve it with garlic bread
Thank you for the positive response! I'm glad i was able to be of help. I hope you enjoy your macaroni and cheese and have a lovely day!
Thank you, you too!

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Do yoou have any dinner suggestion?
Do you have any food allergies and if they have any specific dietary requirements?
No I can eat all foods.
What is your skill level in cooking and your time availability for cooking?
I'm an advanced cook but I only have half an hour tonight to cook dinner.
What types of dishes do you frequently cook each week and your cuisine preferences?
I love Asian food!
Do you like Fried Rice? It's an easy dish that will be done in under half an hour. Here is a link...  https://chefsavvy.com/the-best-fried-rice/
That sounds great!
Is there anything special you like about fried rice?
Yes, when it's cooked using the wok hei or the breath of the wok. It's so yummy!
Thank you for sharing that about wok hei. I knew nothing about that before our conversation. I hope you have a great dinner （＾∀＾●）ﾉｼ bye.
Thank you, I'm sure dinner will be great.
Hello, I'm looking for suggestion for breakfast.
Do you have any allergies, or health restrictions such as keto or diabetic?
No allergies but I am following a keto diet but I don't like eggs.
These pancakes sound delicious, and though they have eggs in them they, don't taste like eggs. Here is a link... https://chocolatecoveredkatie.com/keto-pancakes/  Tell me what you think.
They do sound delicious. I have no problem with eggs when they are used like this.
That's great so you don't mind eggs inside a recipe? I'm curious what about these pancakes that you like?
As long as I don't see an actual egg I'm fine. I like the chocolate chips! I love chocolate!
Thank you for helping me understand what you like. It will help me find better recipes for you in the future. Have a wonderful breakfast （＾∀＾●）ﾉｼ
Thank you!
Hello, I'd lie some suggestions on what to make for lunch.
Are you allergic to anything? How much time do you have to make lunch? Is there any food you don't like?
No allergies. I only have 15 minutes to make lunch. I don't like canned tuna.
Do you have any preference in nationality of the food?
I love Asian food!

I found this recipe for  Asian lettuce cups. They sound really good and healthy... https://www.yummly.com/recipe/Asian-lettuce-cups-with-spicy-ground-turkey-filling-309604?prm-v1   Let me know what you think.
They sound great! I used to eat something like this when I lived in SE Asia. Thank you so much!
Nice! What do you like about this recipe?
I love how healthy it is and also anything with peanuts always gets me.
Thank you for letting me know about your love for peanuts. I'll be sure to keep that in mind when recommending recipes in the future. Have a great lunch! （＾∀＾●）ﾉｼ
Thank you!
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
glad to hear!
Thank you for joining me today! Hope I can help in your cooking journey!
I don't know what to cook today, need help
Do you have any food allergies or dietary requirements?
no i do not
How many years do you have cooking experience?
about 3 years i believe
Do you consider yourself a beginner cook?
yes i do
what time of meals do you typicaly cook each weekday?
stuff like burgers, pasta, and tacos

https://www.allrecipes.com/smash-burger-taco-recipe-7485747

I believe this recipe can fit your needs, a unique take on burgers made into a taco form!
awesome, will give it a try, sounds good!
What do you like about this recipe?
The mix of burgers and tacos is something you don't see a lot, i like also the smash burger reference, i love smash burgers
THank you for your honest feedback and support, i hope this was useful!
have a good day!
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello, I am looking for dinner recipe ideas!
Great! Before we begin do you have any food allergies or specific dietary requirements that I should be aware of?
I am a vegetarian
Thank you.  Can I also ask how long you have to prepare this meal and would you like an easy, moderate or complex recipe?
I have under 30 mins and would like an easy to moderate recipe

To ensure I get the right selections, what are some of the dishes you frequently cook each week?

 Do you have any specific cuisine preferences, favorite ingredients, or flavors you enjoy in your meals?
I cook a lot of pasta and I like italian food

Thank you for that information.  Here is a recipe I found for you.  This is an Italian-inspired pasta dish that can be prepared in under 30 mins.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/orzo_risotto_with_lemon_81355
Thanks.  I like orzo but would prefer something more tomato based

Great!  Here is an alternative recipe, this time a tomato based pasta that is easy to make.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/spaghettini_allassassina_34566
I like that but are there any alternatives?

Here's another vegetarian recipe for a tomato based pasta that can be preapred in under 30 mins

https://www.loveandlemons.com/pasta-pomodoro/
Yes! I like this one, I like the creamy sauce and that it still matches my request
Great! For future reference, can I ask what characteristics of this dish you like?  Do you prefer creamier pasta dishes?
I like tomato based but I also like tomato & cheese
Thank you for your feedback and helping me refine my selections.  It has been great assisting you!
Thank you
hello!
Hello! Are you looking for breakfast, lunch, or dinner recipes today?
I'm looking for quick breakfast recipes

Great!  I just have a few questions before we begin.

Do you have any special dietary requirements?
What type of cuisine do you like?
Do you have any ingredients that you wish to include?
I am a vegetarian and I like 'brunch' style food.  I have no ingredients in mind but I would like something sweet
Great! Do you have any recipes you typically cook for breakfast or shall I look for something new?  Can I also check how long do you have to prepare this dish?
I don't normally cook so I would like something easy and under 20 mins

https://www.olivemagazine.com/recipes/quick-and-easy/classic-french-toast/

Here is a recipe for sweet french toast that can be made in under 10 mins
I don't have any bread

Okay, here is a bread free recipe that meets your suggestions.
https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/best-ever-fluffy-american-pancakes-cherry-berry-syrup

You can change the toppings to include any ingredient you prefer
yes I like this one
To help me understand your preferences, can I ask what it is that you like about this recipe?
I like that I can change the toppings and adapt the recipe
Thank you for your help in assisting me. Have a great day!
thank you goodbye
