i like to mix it up and play around with different ingredients, although where I live availability of the more exotic items is a little harder to come by so have to order those onlline if i want something specific. i would prefer meat-based, but if something sounds interesting, i will certainly try it.

Great! I think we're getting there! I know you said you like Indian and Thai, but have you considered Middle Eastern? The dishes are full of flavour and will also allow you to use your kitchen skills to the max...perhaps while learning some new ones?

https://www.recipetineats.com/hummus-lamb/

https://dinnerthendessert.com/middle-eastern-meatballs-kofta-kebabs/

https://feelgoodfoodie.net/recipe/lebanese-rice/

These look excellent. I'd never considered trying Middle Eastern before! what a great suggestion. This has got everything i'd want! meat and rice as well as great flavours. the only thing i'd perhaps like to see different is a different meat as it is 2x lamb.

Of course, we can find an alternative for you!

I would keep the houmous dish as I think it is such a great way to enjoy this. I would perhaps look at chicken for the other. How about:

https://cookingmadehealthy.com/middle-eastern-chicken-kebabs-shish-tawook/

The beautiful thing about chicken is you can make the flavour as intense as you like!

This dish has a nice amount of prep as well a fairly standard ingredients which you should be able to easily obtain from your local supermarket.
that's great. i love chicken. it's probably my favourite meat. i liked the meat ball idea of the other recipe though. is there a chicken option here you could recommend?

I am sure we can find that for you. do you have any other considerations with the chicken option? i ask simply because with lamb there is so much flavour from the meat itself, with chicken it is a little less. do you still want intensity of flavour or are you looking for something a little more delicate?

are you happy with the same cooking method as the lamb dish, i.e. in a frying pan?
i would still like some intensity to the dish and yes, i am happy using the frying pan to cook this dish.

I would try this dish:

https://www.thebigsweettooth.com/kofte-dejaaj-middle-eastern-chicken-meatballs-koftas/

It has everything you need and, because of its nature, it allows you to control the level of herbs and spices you add to it, so it is completely to you taste.

The advantage with minced dishes is you get to mix them up, cook a little to try and then adjust as you see fit. you get to eat while you cook!
this is excellent. i hadn't considered the idea of mixing, trying and adding more to the mix until i find what i like. that's an excellent suggestion.

ingredient_availability: more exotic items need to be ordered online

dialogue.message: Good morning. I am bored of my normal breakfast. Can you recommend something for me please? something a little more exciting than just toast and butter.

Breakfast is always a tricky one to get right. we're told it's the most important meal of the day, but often we dedicate the least time to it.

how much time do you have available to you for breakfast?

do you normally cook your breakfast or have it straight from the fridge/toaster?

Have you got any particular things you would like to eat for breakfast but haven't got the time to prepare?

what about any allergies or restrictions we need to consider? are you trying to have a healthy breakfast so you can maybe indulge a little later in the day?

i have pretty much no time in the mornings. i have to be out of the house early and don't cook because i don't want to make too much noise and wake up the rest of the house. i normally have toast or a bowl of cereal...maybe a yoghurt, but during the week i am not very adventurous...that gets saved for the weekend where we have breakfast as a family. i need help for monday to friday.

We can definitely offer you something more exciting than cereal, but, seeing as you like yoghurt and cereal, how about we combine the two?

https://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/bircher_muesli_70498

Bircher Muesli is a great way to start the day, HAS to be prepared in advance, so you can do it the night before so it's ready for you in the morning. All you have to do is take it out of the fridge and eat it. you can even make a batch to save you a bit of time and money.

you can also mix it up a little bit with different fruits and seeds depending on what's in season or what you have a hankering for.

Would you be willing to give it a try and let me know how you get on with it?
i would definitely be willing to try it! i like the fact i can play around with it to make it more interesting. do i have to use plain yoghurt or can i use flavoured if i want to?

The wonderful thing about food is that there are no limits! if it tastes good to you, then eat it! there is no need to stick to plain yoghurt. you can try vanila, strawberry, banana, greek yoghurt with honey; you're th boss.

the more combinations you can think of, the less likely you are to get bored with this and the more interesting your breakfasts will be.
this is excellent. i really like black cherry yoghurt and pumpkin seeds, so will try that as my first batch.

I'm so pleased we found an option for you and that you're going to give it a try.

a great way to experiment with Bircher Muesli is to go to the local market and see what they have there for you to put in it. you could really go wild and perhaps add a little lemon grass to it to give it a little subtle zestiness!

The sky's the limit - enjoy experimenting with it!
Thank you so much. i can't wait to get started and try.

time_availability: have to be out of the house early
companions: breakfast as a family on the weekend

dialogue.message: good evening. i am wondering what to have for lunch tomorrow. we have friends coming over and want to do something simple, but quite impressive at the same time.

having people over is always a difficult balancing act between being the host and serving up something nice for everyone to enjoy.

how much time do you have for preparation in the morning/night before?

are your friends an easy crowd to please or do you have different dietary requirements to cater for? i.e. are any of them training for a marathon or have other considerations we need to make?

Is it a special occasion, or just lunch with friends and, dare i say it, a glass of wine or two?

i have very little time in the morning before, and none the night before. i have to get it all ready in about an hour before they arrive. we have one vegetarian in the group, but they are happy with dairy and eggs. other than that, there are no other considerations - no one is dieting or has any allergies.

I think we've got a nice option here:

https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/245775/spaghetti-alla-carbonara-the-traditional-italian-recipe/

you can easily separate out the guanciale to serve for those who want it, alternatively, this is not such a difficult dish for someone with your skills to make two different batches. it is ready in about 30mins, can be done while talking with your guests and is always an impressive lunch, especially if you service it with some garlic bread from the supermarket.
i like that idea a lot, but finding guanciale here is a little difficult and i don't have time to order it online before tomorrow. what can i use as an alternative?

If guaincale is hard to come by, then bacon is always a good substitute:

https://dinnerthendessert.com/easy-bacon-carbonara-pasta/

alternatively, if you can find it, pancetta is also very good:

https://anitalianinmykitchen.com/carbonara-pancetta-and-egg-pasta/

both of these meat options provide the fat and the salt we need to give carbonara its unique flavours.

If we are looking at substitutes, for the vegetarian option, you can use asparagus:

https://www.bonappetit.com/recipe/vegetarian-carbonara

would you be happy to give these a try? The asparagus version doesn't require much additional preparation so shouldn't overburden you as far as time is concerned.

yes, i would be happy to try these all. i think i will take the pancetta option for the meat carbonara as i know they have that in my supermarket. if i can't get asparagus, what other options are there? i am worried about it being out of season or poor quality.

what is the most important consideration for your alternative for the vegetarian option? prep time or availability of items? really, just like your Bircher Muesli, there are no limits and you can use what you would like.

Mushrooms are always a great option for carbonara, or you can go in any direction you like and try courgette or perhaps garden peas? they all provide a different flavour and texture for your guest.

speed is the key. i have all sorts of ideas running through my mind right now, such as roasted squash, but i simply don't have the time. i think i will go with the garden pea option if i can't find asparagus.

That's great. I am glad we came up with some alternative options for you should the first choice ingredients not be available.

have a great lunch with your friends - i am sure you will do a fine job with their carbonara's!
thank you for all your help.

time_availability: very little time in the morning
about an hour before they arrive
diet_requirements: one vegetarian happy with dairy and eggs
seasonal_ingredients: concern about asparagus being out of season or poor quality

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
I'm trying to think of what I should cook for dinner
I can definitely help. Are there any allergies or dietary restrictions to keep in mind?
well, my wife needs things that are soy free and gluten free.
Of course. We can accommodate that. What is your skill level in cooking? Would you be comfortable with something complex or more as a beginner? Any time constraints?
I have a lot of experience, but it's a mid-week meal. So maybe less than an hour.
Are there any specific cuisines or ingredients you want to draw from or avoid?
we've had a lot of mexican and pasta lately. So maybe something different than that.

How about a tasty Indian dish called Palak Paneer? It's both gluten and soy free if using the right oils in cooking. It's also vegetarian and has very tasty spices without being too spicy.

https://www.indianhealthyrecipes.com/palak-paneer-recipe-easy-paneer-recipes-step-by-step-pics/
that does sound good! what should I serve with it?
What is it about the dish that appeals to you? This will help me in the pairing.
My wife orders this when we go out often.
Excellent! I'm glad we were able to find something you both will enjoy. Thank you for chatting with me!
sure thing. But what about the side dish?
hello! I'd like some recommendations on what to make for breakfast
Absolutely! How much time do you have available? Any preferences or special ingredients to include or avoid?
I have about 30 minutes. I want something high protein and low sugar that will fill me up.

what about these portobello breakfast cups? It's like an eggs benedict but using mushrooms instead of toast to keep it gluten free!

https://arismenu.com/portobello-breakfast-cups/
those do look really good. What would be a good side dish?
Why do you think it needs a side dish? Any ingredient preferences?
I get pretty hungry for breakfast. I normally use potatoes, but I would rather have something high protein or fat.
Thank you for the conversation. You can definitely look for high-protein sides to pair with it or try the breakfast cups on their own.
you don't have any recommendations?

dish_like: something that will fill me up

dialogue.message: hello. I'm looking for something to make for lunch
Great! How much time do you have? Any dishes you typically cook each week or preferences for cuisine or ingredients? Is this just for you? Any special occasion?
I only have about 15 minutes. It's just for me to make in between meetings. I usually have sandwiches and am tired of that.

How about this tuna salad with egg? It's high protein and gluten free and sure to fill you up. Be sure to use a mayonnaise made without soy though.

https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/7935164/tuna-salad-with-egg/
that does look tasty! What's the best brand of tuna to buy for it?
Excellent. What is it about the recipe that excites you?
The herbs in it look really good and I like the veggies and citrus flavors. Which tuna should I buy?
Excellent. I'm glad you like it. Blue Harbor Fish Co. has an excellent wild albacore tuna in water that is line caught and tastes wonderful.
awesome! I'll have to try that :)
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello!
What are you interested in making today? Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner?
I am trying to decide what I might like to make for dinner. I would like it to be easy and a crowd pleaser.
Do you have any food allergies or specific dietary requirements that we need to be concerned about? Does it need to be vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, or low-carb?
No dietary restrictions at all.
Would you like this to be easy? How much time do you want to invest in making this meal?
As mentioned earlier, I would like this to be easy. So something quick would be best.
You want this to be a crowd pleaser so how many will you be serving?
I will be serving my family of 7, 3 of whom are still young kids. So simple palate.

Here is a simple, quick recipe that will be sure to please your large family. Kids will enjoy this as well. It is an easy weeknight dinner and it is a pasta bake. It comes together very quickly. Here is a link to the recipe: https://thecozycook.com/pasta-bake-recipe/
Can you please recommend one more recipe that doesn't have meat?

Here is a meatless recipe that is quick and easy to make, Young kids will enjoy this as will adults! It can be adapted for meat lovers and veggie lovers. It is a pizza with a whole wheat crust. Here is the recipe: https://cookieandkate.com/veggie-pizza-recipe/
This is a great idea! This is something we all can enjoy by putting on our own toppings. Thank you!
Great I am happy that you are satisfied with this recipe I provided. I hope you all enjoy it!
We absolutely will. Thank you again for all your help today.
You're very welcome! Thank you for letting me guide you to a dish I am sure everyone will enjoy.
Bye!
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello..I’m thinking of what to cook for dinner
Of course. Do you have any allergies or dietary requirements?
No allergies. I don’t like onions or mayonnaise.
How skilled are you at cooking? Do you have much time available for cooking dinner?
I would say my skill level is average. I probably have 45 minutes available.
Ok. Are there any particular dishes you cook frequently? And do you favour any cuisine in particular?
I like fish dishes. I also like Indian and Chinese food.

Ok. How about this fabulous Indian recipe for a Goan fish curry? I think you will really like it! What do you think?

https://www.recipetineats.com/goan-fish-curry-indian/
Looks lovely. Do you have any other recommendations

How about this recipe for Cantonese Steamed Fish? It’s a great Chinese dish and you can leave the onions out! Let me know what you think.

https://thewoksoflife.com/cantonese-steamed-fish/
Oh that is better! It looks great and very healthy. I will try and make that.
Great! What in particular do you think you will like about this dish? Are there any specific flavours you like that makes you favour this dish?
I like the level of spice. And how easy it is to prepare.
Thanks for your feedback. Hope you have a great time cooking dinner using the new recipe!
Thanks for your help.
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
I think i want a dish with some spiciness to it for dinner
Are you interested in a dish for dinner?
yes please
Do you have any food allergies , or dietary requirements?
No
Are you experienced with cooking? How much time will you have available for the dish?
Im still a beginner , and maybe around 30 minutes max
Do you have any specific preference, taste, or ingredients ?
Something spicy
I have a recipe for Spicy Crispy Chicken which can be prepared in 30 minutes which is easy for beginners. The spiciness can also be adjusted to your liking. https://fedbysab.com/spicy-crispy-chicken/
Thanks  , I like it , I think i may just try this , seems easy enough
You are welcome, ! What particularly do you like about the dish?
I love chicken , and i like how its soo flavor packed. Its also different from the typical chicken  i make because it also has a sweetness to it
Im soo glad you like the recipe! I hope you enjoy your dish!
For my next dinner I want something that consist of Mexican food

dish_like: Flavor-packed dishes with spiciness and sweetness

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
I would like  to know what to cook for dinner
Do you have any food allergies or dietary restrictions on which you must follow?
I am on a low carb diet. So I would refrain from having too much starch in my dinner
Is there a particular type of cuisine you are adept at cooking? Do you have any preparation methods that you do not wish to undertake?
I cook chinese food, so have an array of asian sauces and spices available. I do not wish to fry or bake.
How much prep time do you have in general? Do you wish to try new recipes that are outside of the typical chinese palette?
I would like to spend no more than 30 minutes in total prep and cook time. I would stick with chinese flavors if possible
Are there favorite ingredients you like using? Perhaps particular flavors you find most familiar?
I like to use chicken or pork as a protein and usually incorporate a good amount of vegetables in my meal. I am ok with the flavors of soy sauce, garlic, chicken seasoning and cilantro
May I suggest a stir fry recipe that calls for chicken and lots of veggies like the one in the link attached? https://www.momontimeout.com/easy-chicken-stir-fry-recipe/
That seems great and is within both my time and ingredient constraints to make
Do you think the time to prepare is appealing in this recipe? What about the ingredients being used?
The prep time is reasonable at around 20 minutes. The ingredients utilizes many vegetables and gives a great flavor of sauce base to contrast.
Thank you for your feedback. Is there anything else you would like me to help with?
that will be all

dish_dislike: do not wish to fry or bake
time_availability: prep time is reasonable at around 20 minutes

dialogue.message: Hello
Greetings? What meal ideas can I assist you with?
I would like a recipe for breakfast
Are there any specific ingredients or cuisines that you typically enjoy or would like for breakfast this time?
I would like something light but warm. I typically enjoy breakfast that is ho
Do you have a particular type of cuisine in mind? Is there a preparation time constraint in mind?
I would like to go with chinese cuisine and I think I can spend up to 90 minutes as this is a weekend breakfast

I can recommend a chicken congee recipe  https://www.madewithlau.com/recipes/chicken-congee
It is both warm and easy to prepare in the time limits of 90 minutes and also avoids the need to fry or bake as per your previous recommendations in cooking methods to avoid
I think this would serve the purpose of breakfast very well
What intrigues you the most about using this recipe of chicken congee?
I like that it is light and while it is a starch, it is also lower in carbs than bread or rice. It also has chicken as the protein.
That sounds great. I will note that for our future recipe recommendations
thank you
Hello. What's for lunch?
What are you in the mood to cook? Is it safe to assume that you are still following the low carb diet?
Yes. I would like to continue following a low carb diet and making it flavors like chinese again.
Are there any flavors you wish to avoid?
This is a meal that I don't want a lot of spice in

Our conversations previously did say that you were also good with the protein of pork. Please see the following recipe for a stir fry that is quite suitable for lunch. https://lowcarbyum.com/chinese-pork-stir-fry-with-broccoli/
yes, That sounds like a good plan
What about this recipe do you particularly enjoy?
I like the stir fry and chinese flavors. I also like pork as it is a very familiar protein for me to work with.

dish_like: stir fry with Chinese flavors and pork

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, thank you. I'm trying to think of what to have for dinner
Sure, I can help you with that. Do you have any dietary preferences or allergies?
Yes, I am vegan but do not have allergies
How much time do you want to spend making this meal and what is your skill level?
I'd rather not spend too long making it as I'm quite busy, maybe half an hour. I have a fair bit of experience cooking most things
What sort of meals do you typically enjoy making, is there anything you don't like? Do you have any health goals that you'd like your meals to reflect?
I like filling meals that the whole family can enjoy. No particular health goals. I dont like mushrooms

Thank you. I would recommend this recipe for you..
https://itdoesnttastelikechicken.com/the-best-ever-lentil-ragu/

It is a lentil bolognese, is filling and only takes 15 minutes. It doesn't include mushrooms and is vegan. What do you think? Please let me know if this is suitable
That sounds perfect, thank you
That's great, glad to be of help. Is there anything in particular that you like about this recipe and is the reason you want to try it?
I love that it is so quick and easy and is a meal that I recognise and that the whole family should enjoy
Thank you, I really appreciate your response and helping explain what you liked about the meal. I hope you enjoy, have a nice day
Thank you, you too

dish_like: filling meals for the whole family

dialogue.message: Hello, I'd like a recommendation for a breakfast recipe please
Sure, I can definitely help you with that. Do you have any dietary preferences or allergies?
I am vegan, but I dont have allergies. I just want a simple vegan breakfast

Ok, I would recommend this recipe. I remember that you said you don't have a lot of time as you are busy, and this recipe requires no cooking so just a few minutes of prep. https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/breakfast-banana-split 
Would you be interested in trying this recipe?
That recipe sounds lovely, I really like that I don't have to cook first thing in the morning and my children will love it
Wonderful! Was there anything you'd like to change about the recipe or any flavours you particularly like?
I love that it is healthy and has lots of fresh fruit, there is nothing I would change
Thank you for your feedback, have a nice day
Thank you, bye

time_availability: prefers recipes that require no cooking due to being busy
companion_preferences_like: recipes that the user's children will love
dish_like: healthy breakfasts with lots of fresh fruit

dialogue.message: Hello, please can I have a lunch recipe idea too? I have similar preferences to dinner with cooking time
Sure thing, is it just you you will be making lunch for, or the whole family? What sort of foods and flavours do you enjoy for lunchtime?
It will just be me this lunchtime, and I would enjoy something cooked, but a lighter version of the sort of food I enjoy for dinner

I have found this great recipe perfect for lunch https://minimalistbaker.com/chickpea-shawarma-sandwich/

It is cooked and takes around 25/30 minutes so within your timeframe and is very simple to make. Chickpeas replace meat to make this dish vegan as required and there is nothing in there you have said you dislike. It is easy to make one portion of but can easily be prepped ahead of time to make for the rest of the family if they would also enjoy
Thank you, I'm not sure if my family would enjoy, but as it's only for me this lunchtime I will gladly eat something like this
Is there anything specific the family would not enjoy, and would you like me to find you an alternative you can all have or would you still like this recipe?
My husband does not like wraps and sandwiches, but it doesn't matter as it's just for me this lunchtime. I will use this recipe, thank you
Thank you, glad to be of help. If you would like help with a lunch recipe you can all enjoy in the future please dont hesistate to ask and I will do my best to find you one. Goodbye
Bye

companion_preferences_dislike: husband does not like wraps and sandwiches

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello. I am looking for recipe ideas for dinner please.
Of course. How many will you be cooking for? Do you or they have any food allergies or specific dietary requirements such as being vegan, gluten-free or low carb?
It will be for 2 adults. There are no dietary requirements.
Are you a whizz in the kitchen or do you prefer something simple to prepare? Do you have a preference of how long you would like to spend on preparing and cooking?
I prefer something simple. I don't want to spend much time on it. Maybe 20 minutes?
What types of dishes do you like to cook each week? Do you have any favourite flavours you would like to include or anything you dislike?
I like Italian dishes. I like lots of fresh vegetables and seafood. I don't like coriander.

How about a quick seafood tagliatelle dish? It will only take 20 minutes and includes fresh seafood, chopped tomatoes and parsley. Here is a link to the recipe https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/20minute-seafood-pasta
I don't like parsley. Do you have any other suggestions?
You could try this Smoked Salmon Carbonara. It is quick to prepare and cook, contains smoked salmon and chives https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/smoked-salmon-carbonara
I like the sound of that. Especially because it is very quick to prepare
Excellent choice. Why did you choose the salmon carbonara?
I love smoked salmon and I think it goes really well with a creamy sauce.
Thank you for providing that information and choosing the recipe. I hope you both enjoy your meal.
Thank you! We will!
Hello. I am looking for ideas for things to have for breakfast.

Hello. How much time do you have available to make something? What types of breakfast dishes do you normally make? Do you have any favourite flavours, seasonal ingredients or anything you dislike? Do you have any dietary restrictions?
I usually make something quick during the week but I could spend a bit longer on breakfast at the weekend. I usually have Fruit n Fibre cereal. I like fruit. I don't want something like a fry up.

As you like something quick during the week and like fresh ingredients, you could make something like a healthy porridge bowl. This one contains oranges, bananas and raspberries and doesn't take too long to prepare and cook. https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/healthy-porridge-bowl
Unfortunately I don't like oranges at all. I do however really like the idea of a healthy porridge bowl.
You could try a cinnamon porridge bowl with raspberries and banana. It's still quite quick to make and contains fresh ingredients https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/cinnamon-porridge-banana-berries
I love the sound of that. I love cinnamon and fresh fruits. And it won't take too long to make.
What specifically about the cinnamon porridge bowl with raspberries and banana interests you? Is there something in particular that you are looking forward to trying?
I love that it has healthy ingredients to flavour the porridge and a bit of spice.
This sounds like it will be the perfect breakfast for you. Thank you for telling me your preferences. I hope you enjoy your breakfast.
Thank you! I look forward to giving it a try :)

time_availability: a bit longer on breakfast at the weekend
dish_like: cinnamon porridge bowl with raspberries and banana

dialogue.message: Hello. I'm looking for recipe ideas for lunch please

Hello. How much time do you have available to make lunch? What type of lunches do you normally make? Do you have any favourite flavours? How many people will you be making lunch for? Do any of you have any health goals or dietary restrictions? Is there a special occasion or theme? What ingredients do you currently have available?

It's just for me. I don't mind spending a bit of extra time on something that will be tasty and filling. I usually have sandwiches but looking for something different. I want it to be healthy but filling. There's no special occasion or theme. I have a tin of tuna, some eggs and fresh vegetables
For a quick and healthy lunch you could make a lentil tuna salad - it only takes 15 minutes https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/lentil-tuna-salad
I like the idea of a tuna salad but I don't want to use lentils
Why not try a Healthy salad Niçoise. It uses tuna and eggs and lots of healthy fresh vegetables. It is also quick to prepare. https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/healthy-salad-nicoise
That sounds delicious. I will definitely give that a try
That's great! What is it that particularly interests you about the Healthy salad Niçoise?
I already have all of these ingredients available and it's healthy but filling
This sounds like it will be the perfect recipe for you. I hope you have an enjoyable and satisfying meal.
Thank you! I look forward to trying it.

time_availability: don't mind spending a bit of extra time

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi there, I was wondering if you could give me some suggestions as to what to cook for dinner. I'm short of inspiration!
Hi, I can of course help you with this. First I need a little more information about your preferences. Please can you tell me if you have any dietary requirements?
Yes of course, I eat everything.
Ok thank you for that. Do you have any food allergies that I should be aware of?
No

Ok thats great. Now if you could give me some context for this meal, that would be helpful. How much time do you have to prepare it, and also what would you say is your level of skill with regard to cooking, just so that I can find the perfect option for you.
I have up to an hour, and I would say that I am a proficient cook. I enjoy it and enjoy making more complexed dishes
Ok thank you for the information. Could I ask for a little more details please? Do you have any preferences relating to the genre of food?
I really love Thai cooking.

Ok perfect. I have a suggestion here based on your enjoyment of thai food, for a thai green curry which takes about half an hour to prep and twenty five minutes to cook.

It involves making your own fragrant green curry paste, which uses ingredients like lemon grass, chillis, lime juice and galangal or ginger, depending on what you are able to purchase when shopping.

Once you had made the paste, you would mix it with coconut milk,chicken, vegetables and stock, and then serve it with rice. 

The website for the dish is here: https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/thai-green-chicken-curry-0

Do you think this could be the recipe for you?
This looks like a great recipe, although I wonder if you could find one using prawns instead of chicken, as I would prefer to eat fish if possible

Oh yes of course, I have actually found a very similar recipe using prawns instead. It follows very similar steps as the previous one, so should be to your liking. Please find the link here: https://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/how_to_make_thai_green_83259
Thank you, this is perfect. It combines all my favourite things. Thai food, cooking, and fish. Thank you
Ok I am glad to see that this recipe is good for you. Can I help you with anything else?
No thank you, this is great. I will get cooking. Thank you
You are really welcome. Enjoy cooking and eating your meal. Have a lovely evening.
Thank you. And you
Thank you for your kind words. Take care
goodbye
Hi there, I wondered if you could help me please. I am interested in making something new and tasty for breakfast and wanted some recipe help

Hello, I will of course be happy to help you, but will need a little more information first please. Can you tell me a little bit about your food preferences, namely whether you have any health goals or dietary requirements that you would like the recipe to fulfil? Are there any specific types of cuisine you would like to focus on? How long do you have to prepare the dish and would you prefer it to be hot or cold? Do you also have any specific ingredients that you would like to see included in the dish

I would like to create a hot breakfast dish please, that avoids carbohydrates and is perhaps middle eastern in flavour palate. I would prefer it took no longer than half an hour, and would love if it included chorizo please.

For the onmis, prepare the turkey traditionally:  https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/food-network-kitchen/classic-roast-turkey-3364110.  Prepare a vegan stuffing separately which all can share:  https://www.loveandlemons.com/vegan-stuffing/.  For the vegan's main dish how about a vegan "chicken" pot pie? Have you considered making overnight oats? You can do most of the work the night before and then add the final ingredients in the morning. Overnight oats are healthy, nutritious and tasty; you can add your own flavours. They don't have too many calories but they also release energy slowly throughout the day. Here's an overnight oats recipe you might like; https://feelgoodfoodie.net/recipe/overnight-oats/

Okay, understood. Just so I'm able to make the best possible recommendations for you, could you tell me how confident of a cook you are, and how long you usually prefer to spend cooking?

I'm not a great cook, to be honest, but I'd like to start trying some new things, so maybe something a little easier but a little adventurous would be good. I don't usually like to spend too long cooking, so maybe anything that takes under an hour to prepare and cook is fine.

Usually I'll eat various vegetable soups, some red meat, some pasta-based dishes and some fish. Nothing too exotic. I'm not too fussed about specific cuisines. As for ingredients, maybe something with sweet potato would be nice. I'll be eating with my family and it will be fairly casual. Most of them are vegetarian. I can't think of any particular ingredients that I wouldn't have access to.

Based on what you've told me, I think you and your family might all enjoy this recipe for a roasted sweet potato and carrot soup. It's warming, with a variety of vegetables including sweet potato, carrot, and onion. It can be prepared in under an hour, and it's great for vegetarians. Would you like to try this recipe? How about this recipe for lentil and sweet potato curry? It's more filling, with more calories per serving, and it has significantly more protein per serving as well, with 27g compared to 11g for the last recipe. It's still vegetarian and actually takes even less time to prepare. Do you like this recipe, or is it not quite right? You can find it at https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/lentil-sweet-potato-curry

Great, I'm glad that I was able to help! Am I able to help you with anything else? Perhaps you would like some additional recipes of a similar nature?

I hope it goes well! Thank you for letting me know your thoughts. Please ask me again if you have any more cooking related queries.

Do you have any types of spices or flavors you would like to use for dinner tonight? Also, do you have a specific time allotment in which you would like to complete dinner (i.e. 30 mins)?

That's perfect! Now let's help you make that mouthwatering pesto chicken pasta. Gather the pre-made pesto sauce, the spaghetti noodles, and the chicken. Place the spaghetti noodles in a pot filled with water (about a little over half full) on the stove between medium to high heat. Watch so it doesn't boil over if you place it on high heat. While that boils for about 9 to 11 minutes, cut the chicken into tiny pieces. Place a skillet with a few tablespoons of olive oil in it on medium heat. Place the small pieces of chicken to let it cook until pink is gone. You can use either 1 or 2 chicken breasts, depending on your desired amount! Here is a creamy pesto pasta recipe I found that uses the ingredients you want and in only about 30 to 40 mins.

https://www.spendwithpennies.com/creamy-pesto-pasta/

This recipe allows you to use any type of noodles if you want - if you decide to change your mind! The recipe does use heavy cream, which you can substitute for almond milk if you like. This recipe has a homemade sauce that is made with the garlic, cream, and cheese or you could replace those ingredients with a pre-made pesto sauce! Would you like to try this recipe?

No this sounds good, i want to try it

I would say intermediate  and I have about 45 min

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi, I'm looking for an idea on what to cook for dinner
Sure! Do you have any food allergies or any specific dietary requirements, such as vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, or low-carb diets?
I don't have any allergies and am not on any particular diet
Could you give me an idea of your skill level from 1-10 in cooking and how much time you have to prepare dinner?
I'd say I'm about a 5 skill level and have about 45 minutes to cook dinner
Could you give me an idea of the types of dishes you frequently cook each week and whether you'd prefer an Italian, Mexican, or American dish?
We eat a lot of Mexican food - that sounds good to me!

Great! Here's a link to a super-easy and quick recipe from Pillsbury that it sounds like you'll love - https://www.pillsbury.com/recipes/mexican-crescent-casserole/6a56cf3e-c422-48c8-a117-9c22a498fd0d

How about this Easy Chicken Enchilada recipe instead - only requires three ingredients! https://www.pillsbury.com/recipes/easy-chicken-enchilada-crescent-bake/f0a76d59-2179-4f32-9ffe-671e263ef26c
That sounds perfect and looks super-easy to make. And I like that it requires so little in the way of ingredients and effort. Thanks so much!
Is there something in particular that appeals to you about the recipe? Is it the simplicity, the few ingredients, or something else?
The simplicity of the recipe is what really strikes me the most.  Such few ingredients is an added bonus!
Thank you so much for your kind words and allowing me to assist you today with finding the perfect dinner!  Is there anything else I can help you with today?
No that was all. Thanks again for your help and have a good day!
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello! So right now I am looking for something to make for dinner. I want to try something I've not made before.
Great! I'm happy to help. Do you have any dietary requirements or allergies?
No allergies, but I am a bit of a picky eater.
I understand. What are the foods you enjoy the most, and what types of things do you want to avoid?

My favourite meals to prepare usually involve meat, such as a steak or a chop, with a simple accompaniment. There are many things I don't like, but it's not consistent, so I'd like some suggestions and I'll tell you if any adjustments need to be made.
OK, and how skilled would you consider yourself to be in the kitchen? It would also be good to know how much time you have available to cook before dinner.
I'm not particularly skilled which is why is stick to simple basic recipes for the most part,  or pre-prepared foods. I don't have a lot of free time as I am working long hours.

How about trying something similar to a meal you've already prepared before, but with a new element? You mentioned you cook steak, so you could try making lamb or pork instead, or try a new side dish to go with it.
That sounds great. Can you come up with a recipe like that?
Here's a recipe for pork ribs, which looks simple and easy to prepare. Do you want to try this? https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/easy-oven-baked-pork-ribs
That looks perfect! Simple and I've not tried it before. I have most of the ingredients already.
That's great to hear. Does that recipe fit your skill level? There are obviously many variations of the recipe you could do if you enjoy it.
Yes it definitely looks doable to me, and I love ribs. I can't wait to try it out
I'm pleased that you like it, hope it goes well. I'll be here if you need any more ideas. Have a great day!
Thanks, you too.

time_availability: not a lot of free time
ingredient_availability: most of the ingredients for the pork ribs

dialogue.message: Hi! Thanks for the rib recipe, it went really well! Now I'm looking for some breakfast inspiration.
Happy to help! How much time to you usually have to make breakfast? Are you cooking for yourself or others?
It's just for myself, I don't normally have long, maybe 30 minutes total to cook and eat.

I've got a perfect suggestion for you - an omelette. It should take less than 10 minutes to make, it's relatively easy and you can add any fillings you like. Here's a simple recipe to get you started: https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/basic-omelette
That is a great idea, I eat eggs a lot but I haven't tried an omelette before. I like this recipe a lot! I want to try adding bacon to my version.
That's an interesting idea! Why bacon specifically?
I love the flavour it adds, and it's something I always enjoy for breakfast. I'm going to enjoy experimenting with the recipe
I'm really pleased that you like it. Enjoy your breakfast!
Thanks!

time_availability: maybe 30 minutes total to cook and eat

dialogue.message: Good morning :) Breakfast was a big success, so now I'm looking for some lunch suggestions
I'd be happy to assist you. Where are you when you're preparing lunch, how long do you have to make it and what to you usually like to eat for lunch?

I usually make lunch in the morning and either store it in the fridge or bring it with me if I'm not going to be home. I usually make simple foods like sandwiches and wraps, so I'm really looking for some new ingredient combinations for them.
How much time do you have to prepare something?
Around 30 minutes normally
Here's a simple sandwich you can try. It's an unusual mix of ingredients, and seems to be very highly rated: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/143052/sweet-and-spicy-turkey-sandwich/
Wow, turkey and strawberry jam? I never would've thought to put those ingredients together, but it is very highly rated. I'll give it a shot.
It seems like the unusual mix appeals to you! Do you think the flavours will pair well together, or do you just want to experiment?
I think I just want to try it. If you don't try, you'll never know :)
I hope it goes well! Good job for being willing to try something new. I'm sure it'll be delicious.
Thank you, I'm looking forward to it.

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hi , great.  I'd like to have something with fish in it I think. Any suggestions?
Sure. Fish is a really good choice. What about a dish with layers of vegetables, fish and some mash on top?
Sounds nice. Is this something I bake in the oven?

Ah yes- I should have checked with you what cooking appliances you have. This is a great recipe if you have access to an oven.But don't worry if you haven't- I have lots of others! Also, please let me know if you have any food allergies, intolerances or just plain dislikes.
Yeah, oven is not a problem. I have trouble digesting broccoli, so we should steer clear of that.
Ok, that's fine. The recipe I have in mind takes about 40 minutes in total. Does that suit you?
That should be fine. I'm assuming once I have prepped it , then it will just be a matter of putting it in the oven to cook?

Yes exactly. I suggest par cooking some spinach and layering it on the bottom of a pie dish, then place whatever fish you fancy on top, then cover this with some leeks cooked in milk and thickened with flour and cheese and then top this with mash. Remember to put the potatoes on to boil at the very start of your prep, and turn the oven on to heat to 200 C. When you have assembled the pie layers, put on the oven for 20 mins for fish to cook.
This sounds lovely. Will you send me the link to the recipe?

Here you go. This has some mustard in the leek mixture - which gives it a bit of a kick. And some sweetcorn in the mash- but plain mash works well too. https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/haddock-leek-au-gratin-sweetcorn-mash
Ah that is perfect. Not too many ingredients, and looks very tasty. Thanks a million!
Glad to hear you like it. What's the most appealing bit about it?

Well, I'm having a few people over, just a little week night get together. And I really like the fact that I can have this all prepped and in the oven. No fussing over cooking while my guests are here.
Yes, I know, it takes the pressure oof if you can everything in one dish in the oven. And this really does taste good. `I am so glad you like my suggestion. Have a lovely evening.
Thanks. I'm sure I will now that I have a plan and a recipe.
Hi there, can you suggest a nice hot breakfast please? I'm trying to have a healthy start to the day.

Sure. I don't think you'll be wanting to rush out to the shops in the morning, so let me know what you have in the cupboard/fridge. Do you have any particular likes in the way of breakfast? And does it need to be a speedy recipe?
I don't want anything along the lines of a traditional fry up. But I do like eggs, tomatoes , cheese. I'd prefer to avoid bread. And I am in no great rush time-wise.

Well I have a good recipe that works well if you are cooking just for yourself, but can also be easily scaled up. Let me know if you are open to middle eastern style breakfasts? Are you OK with some mild spice?
It will be just me for breakfast and I like the sound of something a bit different. I'm fine with spices.

Ok, what about shakshuka. The spices are lovely and warm and its is basically eggs poached on top of a tomatoe sauce. It makes a nice lunch dish as well. https://www.loveandlemons.com/shakshuka-recipe/

I like the sound of it. But I don't think I have any bell peppers in the fridge- will leaving those out make a big difference? I like the idea of spinach in my breakfast though- am trying to be really healthy just now.
No, omitting the green peppers will be fine. Do you like spinach generally or is it mainly the health benefits you like?
I actually love spinach. I am so glad it is also very good for you.

Yes, it is great when what is good for you also happens to be what you love. And I think you could customise this dish in lots of ways- add feta cheese if you have some in the fridge. Or you could throe in some coriander leaves for a slightly different taste.
Oh they are good ideas. I like the sound of those added extras. Thanks very much.
Hi , could you suggest something for lunch?
Of course. Is this for a quick lunch during the working day or a more relaxed one?
Oh a quick one please. But not along the lines of a sandwich.
Yes, you are not a fan of bread so sandwiches are out. You like feta and spinach and you like healthy meals . So I suggest something along the lines of a feta salad. Do you like olives?
Yes, olives are fine with me. And I have spinach in the fridge. I have tomatoes as well. I can pop out for feta this evening. Anything else I need?
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello, Im looking for a light fish based receipe not too filling as I have dance class after but do need energy
Excellent, so to clarify a you are looking for a light fish based meal which will provide you with energy for exercise?
Thats correct yes, please advise
Do you have any food allergies or dietary requirements?
No but I dislike corriander
what type of fish do you like?
salmon, cod, haddock only

Great, just a couple more questions.

What level of cooking proficiency are you? Please choose from the following; Beginner, Intermediate, Expert 

How long do you have to prepare the meal?
I am an intermediate level and have 30 mins prep time and up to 30 minutes cooking time
What cuisine preferences do you have and are there any seasonal ingredients you would like to use?
I like mediterranean food and I would like to use some of the mint that is growing in my garden

Recommend a cooked fish stew, a relatively simple light dish which can be cooked quickly, It incorporates mint and can be served with potatoes and green vegetables for energy prior to your dance.

Please visit the below URL for ingredients and methodology: https://www.rnz.co.nz/collections/recipes/mediterranean-style-fish-with-mint
Perfect thank you, it covers my preferences and is light
Excellent news! could you elaborate as to why its perfect any further?
I love garlic and mint!!
Thank you for your feedback. I hope you enjoy your dinner!

Great! i've found a recipe for making Lemon Chicken easy & simple. Will only take around 45 minutes!

yes my cooking time is only 1 hour for breakfast. I have no companions and no real cuisine preferences. I have  a health goal of losing weight. No this will not be for any special occasions

well i do like my bacon to be american style bacon. Eggs i like cage free

I like chicken, I mostly just cook bits but a whole roast chicken with some fresh seasonal vegetables and roast potatoes would be nice. No special occasion really.

https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/classic-roast-chicken-gravy

This is a good classic roast chicken recipe with a great gravy option. You could add halved potatoes to the dish with the chicken to rast them in the juices. Steamed fresh cabbage or broccoli would make a great accompaniment and would be simple to make alongside the chicken.

Breakfast

I like eggs, any kind really. It's just me. I like avocadoes when they are in season. I make scrambled and poached eggs a lot. No special occasion

https://www.purelyorganiceggs.co.uk/post/vegetarian-eggs-benedict-with-avocado

Here is a great recipe for eggs benedict with avocado. A little bit more effort than just simple poached eggs but really worth it. You can add spinach if you wanted some fresh greens with it.

i like that it uses organic eggs, i only buy organic eggs. and it's vegetarian

Are you cooking for yourself or for others? Are thereany seasonal ingredients you prefer? Do you have any dietary restrictions or health goals in mind? I only have under an hour to cook and eat it. I make wraps a lot for my lunch, i like those. Just cooking for me, no special occasion. I like chicken, yes. I also like fresh salad and chutneys and cheese. I like tinned crab and avocado. No health goals or dietary restrictions.

Otherwise a simple ploughmans salad or sandwich will not take long to make, just have some good wheaten bread with mature cheddar, chutney or pickle and some ham or pate if you wish, although it's entirely optional. Here's good recipe for it: https://www.deliciousmagazine.co.uk/recipes/ploughmans/

I think that it just looks like a hearty delicious lunch with no cooking and little prep work. Just put everything on a plate!

I think that it just looks like a delicious lunch with no cooking and little  prep work
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!

I have no food allergies or dietary requirements
Excellent. Thank you for the information. How would you rate your level of cooking skill? How long do you have to prepare and cook this meal?

I usually choose dishes that are quick and simple as I do not want to spend much time on them after a day at work. I like pasta dishes and try to ensure that I include lots of vegetables for a balanced diet.

Wonderful. Thank you for the information. I have the perfect recipe for you. A pasta primavera is quick and easy to make and this also has plenty of vegetables included too! Would you like to try this recipe that I have located for you?

https://www.themediterraneandish.com/easy-pasta-primavera/

Thank you for using our recipe recommendation service. I am so pleased that you have found a new recipe to try. If you have any more questions in the future, feel free to ask. Have a great time cooking!
Thank you!

Hi there! Are you looking for recommendation about breakfast, lunch, dinner, or something in between?
Breakfast
Your earlier preferences have been recalled. Do you have any specific preferences or restrictions for breakfast is regards to time constraints or ingredients?
I like to eat immediately after getting up, so it needs to be something I can make quickly or store overnight. Also, I typically like to have something with cocoa in it for breakfast.

I think I found something you might like! This is a simple, versatile recipe that includes your preferred ingredients and can be made in as little as 5 minutes. Let me know what you think. https://www.quakeroats.com/cooking-and-recipes/cocoa-oatmeal
It looks very tasty and nutritious. I think I will try it.

I like the versatility and the fact that fresh fruit if I have any. It seems like an ideal and traditional breakfast food that ticks all of my boxes.
I am glad you like the recipe! I hope you have an excellent morning when you decide to try it!
Thank you, goodbye.

Hi there! I recall your previous preferences. Is there anything new you would like to add for this meal, or for lunch in general?
I should have plenty of free time around lunch today, so I could go for something a bit more complicated to prepare. Otherwise, I have no specific lunchtime requirements.
Excellent, perhaps there is something new you would like to try? For instance, can you think of any fall flavors you would like try or tinker with?
Now that you mention it, I suppose I wouldn't mind something with pumpkin in it, or a pumpkin flavor.
This seems like an excellent option for fall that fits your preferences. Please let me know what you think. https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-maple-pumpkin-muffins/
I like it. Seems like a good option for a light lunch.

Thank you, goodbye.

. Delete this advice and compose your utterance in this text box.) Are you quite good at cooking and do you have time to make something special?

Okay no asparagus, but omelette is a good choice.  https://www.diabetes.org.uk/guide-to-diabetes/recipes/mushroom-and-spring-onion-omelette here is another option it meets all your requirements and is and omelette with no asparagus. What do you think about this recipe?

Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!

Hello, I'm having some friends round tomorrow and I'm in need of an easy recipe that can cater for four people, two of them are vegetarian, can you please help me come up with some ideas of what to cook?

Of course, I would be happy to help you find an easy recipe for you to cook dinner for your friends. Some meals, such as pizza, pasta or curries, can be really easy to cook in large amounts, and are perfect when cooking for groups of people. Do you have a preference for the type of cuisine that you are looking for?
Pizza sounds like a safe option, everyone likes pizza right? I've never made a pizza before. What ingredients would I need?
Before I provide you with a list of ingredients, do you or your friends have any food allergies or dietary requirements?
Two of my guests are vegetarian and there are no other dietary requirements or allergies to speak of.
Thank you for this information. What is your skill level when it comes to cooking? And how much time will you have available for cooking for your friends?

I'm a bit of a beginner when it comes to cooking. I can make the odd pasta dish, but most of my cooking involves taking food out of the freezer and putting it in the oven. I finish work at 5 and my friends are coming round at half 6, so I will have roughly one hour for cooking.

Thank you for providing my with your cooking skill level and your time constraints. Don't worry, making a pizza is easy! Do you and your friends have any preferences when it comes to the ingredients used in your pizza? And do you and your guests have any health goals? Pizzas are a very versatile dish and can be catered for everyone. As the weather is getting colder, you may wish to consider making a pizza with fresh vegetables, or a pizza with fresh chillies to help heat your evening up!
I like lots of vegetables on my pizzas. I'm currently trying to be a bit healthy with my diet but I don't mind treating myself and my friends.

Thank you for your information, I can certainly help you find a recipe that will cater to your preference for vegetables on your pizza and one with options for making it as healthy or indulgent as you like. 

Here is a recipe I think would be ideal: https://cookieandkate.com/veggie-pizza-recipe/

This recipe has options for making your pizza as healthy or indulgent as you see fit. It also contains lots of vegetable toppings and the whole pizza can be made in 45 minutes, which fits perfectly within your one-hour time frame. You have the option to make the cooking time even faster by opting for store-bought pizza sauce, or you can invest a bit more time by making your own. 

Please let me know your feedback on this recipe.
That looks perfect! I can be as creative or as quick with it as I want and it's given me ideas of what vegetables to put together as toppings. Thank you!
I'm pleased to hear you like the recipe! If I can assist you with any other recipes or any questions you may have then please do not hesitate to let me know.
That's all for now, thank you.
My pleasure, have a great day!
Thanks, you too!
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hey chat, I need an idea for dinner tonight.  My parents are meeting my girlfriend's parent s for the first time.
That's a big milestone in the relationship, I'm sure you want it to be special. Do your guests have any dietary restrictions or allergies? How about preferences?
No allergies, thankfully. But my mother is a pescetarian. It will have to be seafood.
Fish is usually fairly quick to make. How long do you have before dinner guests arrive? And how comfortable are you in the kitchen - what's your level of proficiency?
I've got plenty of time. And I'm no pro chef, but I'm not too shabby either. I would say, comfortable home cook.
That gives us plenty of possibilities. What kind of things do you normally cook for yourself?
I'm pretty good with pasta dishes. Tacos. I make some mean soul food. My granny is cajun so I've learned a lot of cajun dishes as well.

Since your mother is a pescetarian, and you're proficient with pasta and cajun food, I recommend Cajun Shrimp Linguine. It's fast, and not too difficult, while being very flavorful and rich. It's sure to impress, and everyone can enjoy it, including your mom. Here's the link to the recipe: https://grandbaby-cakes.com/cajun-shrimp-linguine/
Do you think it's something you might like to try?
That sounds really good, and it does tick all the boxes. What about a side dish?  A nice salad?

Great, I'm glad you like the suggestion. I think a salad would be a good side dish - something light to accompany the rich main course. 

Can you tell me what you like about the Cajun Shrimp Linguine? I'd like to keep your preferences in mind .
Sure. First of all, it will make my mother happy. Also, everyone likes shrimp. It doesn't look too difficult to make but it sounds like the kind of dish my grandmother would have made.
Thank you for taking the time to give me your feedback. I hope you have an enjoyable dinner tonight. Farewell.
Thanks for the help! Later!

occasion_or_theme: Meeting of parents for the first time

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello, I'm trying to figure out what to make for dinner. Do you have any recommendations?
Sure, but first do you have an allergies or dietary restrictions?
No, I don't have any allergies and I can eat everything without restrictions.
Alright, how would you rate your cooking experience? Would you consider yourself a beginner, novice, intermediate or expert chef? Also, how much time do you have to make dinner today?
I'd say I'm a novice in the kitchen but I can follow recipes pretty well. I'd like to spend no more than 2 hours if possible.
Okay, and what kind of food do you usually cook? Are there certain flavors or ingredients you like to use? And do you have any seasonal ingredients that you'd like to make use of?
I usually cook simple dishes like pasta and soups. I prefer fish and chicken and try to avoid too much red meat. I like to use a lot of garlic when possible. I don't have any seasonal ingredients.

Alright, I think I've found the perfect recipe for you. It's fish based, uses lots of garlic and its quick and easy to make. It's called Parmesan Crumbled Fish. Follow this link (or copy and paste) to the recipe: https://www.recipetineats.com/healthy-parmesan-garlic-crumbed-fish/
That looks perfect, thanks
I'm glad you like it. Did you like anything in particular about the recipe?
I like that its fish, has a garlicky taste and is easy to make.
I'm very happy that I was able to find a recipe for you. Enjoy dinner and let me know if you ever need help deciding on your next meal. Cheers!
Okay, thanks again.

dish_like: Simple dishes like pasta and soups

Good morning, I can definitely help you choose. First, do you have any allergies or dietary restrictions?
No, I have zero allergies. I have no dietary restrictions but I would prefer to avoid pancakes, waffles and toast.

Alright, what do you normally cook for breakfast? What ingredients do you have available to use? Also, do you have any seasonal ingredients that you'd like to use? And how much time do you have to make breakfast?

I usually have Eggo waffles and coffee but I want something healthier this time. I have eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms, butter and cheese. I don't have any seasonal ingredients. I don't want to spend too much time cooking in the morning.

Alright, I think I've found the perfect recipe for you. It's easy to make and filled with healthy vegetables. It called an Easy Tomato and Mushroom Omelette. Click the link to check our the recipe: https://recipes.net/breakfast/omelette/easy-tomato-and-mushroom-omelet-recipe/
Okay, I that looks easy enough to make and I should have most of those ingredients. I'll try that thanks.
That's great, and just to be sure I found the right recipe for you, what did you like from the recipe?
I liked that it's quick to make, much healthier than pancakes and that I already have most of the ingredients.
I'm glad I could find a breakfast recommendation for you. I hope you enjoy your omelette! Please let me know if you ever need help finding more recipes.
Alright, thanks.

Alright, what do you normally cook for lunch? Do you have any ingredients or flavors you want to have? Do you have any seasonal ingredients you want to use? How much time do you have for lunch?

I usually make a turkey sandwich for lunch but I'd like to make something healthier this time. I have some left over roasted chicken I can use. I don't have any seasonal ingredients. I also don't want to spend too much time cooking.
Okay, and do you have any allergies or dietary restrictions?
No, I don't have any allergies or dietary restrictions but I do want something healthier than a turkey sandwich.

Alright, I think I've found the perfect lunch recipe for you. It's healthy, easy to make and uses your left over chicken. It's called a Chopped Power Salad with Chicken. Click on the link to see the recipe: https://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/7917784/chopped-power-salad-with-chicken/
Okay, it looks healthy and I have those ingredients.
Great and just to verify that this recipe works for you, what do you like about it?
I like that it's healthy, easy to make and I can use my left over chicken in it.
I'm glad that you liked the recipe! Please let me know if you ever need help finding other recipes. Cheers!
Okay, will do, thanks.

There are a big range of breakfast options. Do you want something hot or cold? Do you have a time limit? People are often in a hurry at breakfast time. Do you have a type of food in mind?
Something hot. But quite quick.  Nothing overly complicated either. I like eggs.

No, I don't have any food allergies or any dietary requirements

I would say I am a beginner when it comes to cooking (I only know the basics). I have at least two hours available every day to prepare and make my dinner

I like to cook Mexican and Italian dishes each week (such as tacos and ravioli). I prefer to have other types of cuisines from time to time as well (other then Mexican and Italian) such as Asian and Mediterranean style cuisine foods

dialogue.message: Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
hello, i need to know how to cook macaroni cheese
hi there, that sounds a good meal. Do you want a quick and easy lunch type meal, or perhaps a more complex full dinner style recipe? oh and before we begin: does anyone have any alergies?
i would like a nice simple lunch recipe as i'm new to cooking
Great, but first does anybody have dietary requirements of allergies? how much time do you have to cook this meal? Different recipes can take different amounts of time and prepping.
i have about an hour to cook the meal

Here is super easy Macaroni Cheese recipe you could try that uses just the hob stove to prepare - it will take around 23-30 minutes. https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/238691/simple-macaroni-and-cheese
okay, i will have a look at this and see if i can make it

Sure! Its worth remembering that if you are new to cooking you may need to check recipes well in advance of cooking to ensure you have all the ingredients, and to give yourself time to nip to the shops to buy ingredients if you need to.
i think i have all these ingredients - my friend likes peppers though, so can i add  pepper some how?

i'm really glad you like the recipe! And yes, peppers (as well as onions) go well with Mac * cheese. Its good to hear you want to explore different ingredients and flavours. One method with papers would be to finely shop them, then lightly fry them till till golden and sprinkle them on top of the dish just before serving.
oh that sounds great, THank you!
hello robochef
Hello there! ... how can i help you in the kitchen today?
i'm looking to bake a cake for my son's birthday, can you help?
That sounds fun. We need to start by knowing if anybody eating the cake has any allergies or dietary requirements?
yes. one person can not have eggs.

aaaahh, many cakes do require eggs, so this does limit our options. However there also many recipes that dont use eggs or use a substitute.  Are there any flalvours your son would really like that we could include in the cake?
i loves orange, and also mint flavours
Ok, well here we have an eggless chocolate & orange drizzle cake. How much time do you have? this will take about 25mins preparation time,  and 25-30 minutes cooking time.
i have all morning to to make the cake so that should be fine. I'll have to go to the shops though
So are you happy with the eggless chocolate orange cake?
yes, i think so.
That's great! and remember i'm always here if you need any help during the cooking of your cake. speak to soon, bye!......
thankx

i need help, a friend likes fish.. i need to make a fish meal

its for tomorrow dinner, so i have time to go shopping. this person also eats a lot of veg, so do you have any recipes with lots of fresh veg?

that sounds pretty good.. please continue

no alergies

Better stll it all fish and veg go in the same baking tray! https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/roast-sea-bass-vegetable-traybake
this looks great, i lke that it all just cooks in one dish in the oven

Chicken please.

Thank you! I mix it up - on a weekday I often have toast or cereal, then on a weekend when I have more time I have a cooked breakfast. Either way, I have breakfast at home. I'd lovel something a bit different that I can try out on a weekend though.
Excellent! So, you have more time on a weekend then? Are you looking for something different to a traditional fry up?
Yes, exactly! I'd love something filling but without sausage and eggs.
No problem at all. What would you say was your favourite food to eat?
That's easy. Pizza.

A great choice! how about a breakfast pizza? https://www.foodandwine.com/recipes/smoky-breakfast-pizzas If you've already go the ingredients at home to make a regular pizza, then this one should be really simple, but very filling!

I'm so glad that I have been able to help! Please do let me know how you get on with it and what you think of breakfast pizza! It's certainly something different to the traditional pepperoni and I'm certain you'll love it!
Yes, I'll be sure to. Thanks. I can't wait to try it.
Hi again! Thank you so much for the breakfast pizza recipe, it was delicious! Can yuo help me out with some inspiration for lunchtime now too?
Yes of course. Please tell me a little more about your current lunchtime meals.

Well, it's getting colder outside now, so I want something warm and hearty, that will keep me going through the winter months. A sandwich just doesn't cut it now. I get and hour break for lunch, so time isn't such an issue.

Great, thanks for giving me a bit more background. Yes, it's certainly good to have a warm lunch when it's cold outside. Soups and stews are ideal in this time, and don't have to take long to prepare. Do you like soup?
I love tomato soup, yes!
Fantastic! I know that you like pizza too, so how about a pizza soup - it's pure comfort food and is full of tomatoes: https://www.afarmgirlsdabbles.com/cheesy-pizza-soup-recipe/
Oh wow, that sounds amazing! Am I going to be able to prepare that in my lunch hour?
That's my pleasure. Yes you'll be fine - it take 40 minutes to prepare and cook, leaving you 20 minutes to savour and enjoy.
Brilliant, thank you - I'll be certain to give that a go!

Hello :) I'd be happy to help you with a recipe for dinner tonight. Can I ask if you have any allergies or dietary requirements so I can take those on board? Anything you really like or really dislike?

Well, I'm allergic to certain types of shrimp, so none of those, and I really dislike celery. So I guess that leaves dinner wide open! I do eat meat and I don't have any religious requirements or anything like that.

Great, thank you! Before I provide some suggestions, could you let me know what your skill level in cooking is? I don't want to provide something too overwhelming! Also, how much time do you have available for cooking the meal? I'll try to make it fit that.

Something a bit indulgent, I'm feeling naughty so it doesn't have to be healthy; also something easy I can stick in the oven

Okay thank you. How about a nice indulgent Baked Mac and Cheese? It's a popular favourite and so simple to make. If you want to make it more indulgent or fancy dressing it up a little, you could add bacon or vegetables. You can find the recipe here: https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/best-ever-macaroni-cheese-recipe 

You could leave out the garlic and mustard if you preferred a more classic taste. Would you like to try this recipe?
Oh that looks great thank you. I might even try it with the mustard and garlic, because I'm worth it :)

I don't mind really, any recommendations for things to add?

Certainly. As I mentioned, bacon pieces (or lardons) are a popular thing to add, and give a more savoury texture, you could also use shredded cooked chicken for a similar change. Brocolli or Cauliflower are easy to cook and you can convince yourself you're eating more healthily! I hope this has helped, and I hope you have a great dinner. Thank you for asking for some suggestions.

Oh, that looks good.   And it's Keto, right?
Yes it is.
great!
Is there a specific reason this recipe looks good to you?
Yes, it ticks off all the boxes for me - it's healthy, it has flavor, it has cheese in it.  It looks like a meal I can enjoy all week!
That's great!  I appreciate your feedback, it helps me improve my suggestions.   Have a wonderful day!
Thank you!

I don't have any allergies, I prefer red meat or chicken

ooh, that looks really good, I really like the seasonings used
Do you like the combinations of seasonings or just some of them in general?
I really like the combination of brown sugar and oregano

I hope you have a good day too
Hello there, I'm here to assist you in your culinary adventures!
Hello,  I'm thinking about what to cook for dinner tonight and can't decide, so thought you might have some good ideas.

OK, that's what I'm here for.  Are there any foods you can't eat; either you're allergic to them or just don't like them.  Also, is there anything in particular you want to include in the recipe, and finally are you wanting a quick meal or can it be a slow-cooked meal?
I don't mind how long it takes to cook as I can start it in the morning if necessary.  I have no allergies and will eat almost anything apart from beetroot and parsnips.

There are several slow-cooked meals you could make; beef bourguignon which consists of beef, red wine and vegetables, or slow-cooked lamb with thyme and onions or slow-cooked pork. 
Do any of those sound tempting?
I like the sound of the beef bourguignon with the red wine in it, but I've just thought something a bit quicker would be better after all.
Ok, how about a spicy chicken curry, sweet and sour chicken or even a tasty shepherd's pie.  These can all be made in about an hour and taste delicious.
I haven't had shepherd's pie for years.  Maybe that's a good one to go for.  What will I need to make it?

That's a great choice.  The main ingredients are lamb mince and potato.  You'll also need carrots, onion, Worcestershire sauce, beef stock, tomato puree, oil, butter and milk.  It's very easy to make.
That all sounds easy enough and I've got everything I'd need to make it.  I think I remember when I made it years ago I put cheese on top.

Cheese-topped shepherd's pie sounds delicious.  Here is a recipe you could use:
https://www.marthastewart.com/319350/cheddar-topped-shepherds-pie
How does that sound?
That all looks good but I think I might want to go vegetarian tonight.  I'm thinking of asking my friend over and she doesn't eat meat.

No allergies but one of us is vegetarian

Two

I have plenty of time I guess but I don't want to spend it all cooking. I could do something that cooks slowly though as long as I don't have to do much to it
What else should I know? Do you have any flavor preferences or needs?
I'm vegetarian but my husband isn't, so I need something that can easily have a version with meat and a version without
How about homemade pizzas? Then you can add toppings based on what each person would like. Here's a link to homemade pizza dough: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-pizza-crust-recipe/
That sounds great, thanks
Can you tell me more about why you think this recipe will work for you, so I can better learn about your preferences?
I like that it's easy to make a veg and non-veg version and I like that it's pretty quick and easy to make as long as I start the dough in the morning so it has time to rise
Thanks so much for the feedback. I hope you have a great dinner!
Thanks for the idea

thanks you too

Italian or Asian

i'd like some light dinner suggestions please, vegetarian or vegan

yes, if possible, i'd like to avoid eggs and dairy products other than cheese

i'd say about 5 since i can make pretty much anything if i have the recipe for it. i would prefer that it takes no longer than 30mins to make.

Just a few more questions to make sure I give you a well tailored suggestion:
Could you tell me a bit about your preferences when it comes to food?
Do you especially enjoy a certain country's cuisine?
Are there any specific ingredients or food groups you would like to include in your meal tonight?
Any health benefits you're looking for?

i really enjoy any types of pasta, noodles, dumplings and such, but i'm looking to eat something less carb-heavy so i don't feel too stuffed overnight. so maybe something more vegetable based would work better, don't mind a little bit of carbs on the side though... i enjoy cuisines from a lot of different cultures, but i think i would be almost guaranteed to like something mexican, south american or middle eastern. i don't like raw cilantro though, so maybe something that doesn't have a lot of fresh cilantro in it (a little bit or dried is fine)

What do you think about this 15-Minute Harissa Eggplant Kebabs With Cucumber Mint Relish recipe?
https://www.onegreenplanet.org/vegan-recipe/harissa-eggplant-kebabs/

thank you, this sounds perfect actually. only 15mins to prep and i have all the ingredients (well except for fresh mint, but i do have dried so i'll just use that). vegan so i don't need to worry about dairy & eggs - and not too carby i guess since i can choose how much flatbread i have with it. appreciate the help! ^^
I'm glad I found the right recipe for you. Hope you enjoy preparing and having your dinner tonight! Is there anything else I can help you with?
no, thank you, that is all for tonight
Great! Thank you for using our service and feel free to get in touch anytime if you need meal recommendations. Have a good evening!
bye
